Bioplastic, like the corn-based PLA, is still at its nascent stage. Technology is not matured nor demand is great enough for the price to lower down to a competitive level, as compared to traditional petroleum-based plastic. But the least we could do is to educate the general public of the existence of these eco-friendly alternatives and to promote the awareness of the disadvanatages of petroleum-based plastic. 


  Learn more Click on links below to find out more and share with your friends and family.
http://ecologycenter.org/plastics/
http://www.bpiworld.org/
http://science.howstuffworks.com/environmental/earth/oceanography/great-pacific-garbage-patch1.htm
http://www.citizenscampaign.org/campaigns/plastic-bags.asp
http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Polylactic_acid
http://www.natureworksllc.com/The-Ingeo-Journey/Eco-Profile-and-LCA/How-Ingeo-is-Made

*Our corn-based bioplastic products biodegrade and decompose best at commercial composting facility, home-based composter, or landfill under the right temperature with right amount of humidity. Do not discard them by the street, freeway or ocean/river. It's not designed to biodegrade under those environments.

story:
WE NEED YOUR HELP – The Gulf Wild ByCatch Conservation Fund

Our ByCatch Conservation Fund is a unique outgrowth of Gulf Wild- our non-profit brand of conservation based seafood.  Our goal is to reduce the amount of Gulf bycatch – a fish caught unintentionally in a fishery (while intending to catch other fish), usually referring to different species, or undersized and juvenile fish of the target species. Bycatch greatly decreases the sustainability of the fisheries Gulf Wild is working hard to protect for generations to come.

This is why we created the ByCatch Conservation Fund, which will:

·  Educate: By sharing the benefits of fishery conservation and our ByCatch program, we’re ultimately helping in their efforts to fish another day.

·  Tag: Whereas our typical species are tagged with a blue tag, our ByCatch fish are tagged with green to help differentiate.

·  Distribute: Waste not, want not. Instead of throwing back bycatch to ultimately die, we’re going to distribute it along with our usual catch-of-the-day to like-minded distributors, chefs and consumers across the United States. 

·  Market: We’re the first to admit that outside of our small industry, the term, and even concept of, bycatch is relatively unknown. We need to change that by educating sustainable-minded, seafood-loving consumers on what it is, why they should care and ultimately how they can help.  In short, we want consumers to look, and ask, for them in their local grocery store!

. Innovate: We are working with scientists throughout the world and of course our faithful captains to explore simple solutions to high tech devices that prevent bycatch of sea turtles, coast sharks and seabirds.

·  Fund: None of the above will work without the support of partners that understand and support our goals. If you’re concerned about where your seafood is from, how it was harvested and that you are making a difference for that next generation of fishermen and fish, support our efforts.  Support Seafood with Certainty.

Help us make a difference for our oceans, our fisheries, your seafood and Captain Bobby. Support this big blue planet or simply your love for the taste of red snapper. We simple can't do this without your help.

Thank you,

Your Friends at Gulf Wild

story:
About the Trip (And Me!)

In the fall of 2013, I, along with eight other people, will embark on and film a three month long canoe journey down the Mississippi River from the headwaters in Lake Itasca, Minnesota, to New Orleans. As we paddle, we will engage communities in an ongoing dialogue about their relationships to and interactions with this watertrail to give voice to the Mississippi River, its inhabitants, and the many perspectives we encounter along the way. Upon completion of the trip, we will produce a documentary of this journey so that these vital conversations can continue with others beyond the flow of the river.

From my early days as a Clearwater Camper paddling in the Boundary Waters and leading Camp Manito-wish YMCA trips in the Quetico, to extended expeditions on the Yukon and Missinaibi Rivers and guiding inner-city youth in BWCA through Big City Mountaineers, paddling and portaging a canoe is something I love to do. More importantly, though, I strive to expose others to the outdoors in order to build pivotal connections to our natural environment. Through my experiences on rivers and lakes, I've developed a humble appreciation for my dependence on these natural resources. As a Geology student at Colorado College, I took numerous field-based geology courses and wrote grants for independent reseach projets and wilderness trips. I am thrilled to venture down the Mississippi River, engaging with communities who depend on this great resource and educating myself and others about the dependence this river has on us to protect it.

I need your support in order to make this educational adventure a reality!

Why Paddle the Mississippi? 

As the climate debate comes to a head in the United States, it’s easy to get caught up in abstract political jargon and lose sight of the everyday people whose lives revolve around the health of a natural resource. Getting to know community members and share these interactions through the documentary we are making will allow others to get involved in our story.

I have always aspired to canoe the entire Mississippi River. At this stage of my life I feel fortunate to be able to seek opportunities like this, and I will work hard to continue inspiring others to strive for similar goals.

What I Need:

food:

Food for one day:

$11

Food for one week:

$77

Food for one month:

$308

Food for the whole trip:

$924

transportation post-trip:

Ship a canoe to Minneapolis

$226

Pay for one person to travel back to the Twin Cities

$350

 

Total Trip Cost:         $1,500

 

What Do You Get If You Help Fund My Campaign?

$25 – A postcard from the river and big bear hugs.

$100 – Your name featured in the credits of our documentary, a postcard and huge bear hugs.

$500 – A shout-out to you or your organization on our twitter and facebook with a picture of me featuring your name or company, your name featured in the credits of our documentary, a postcard, and polar bear hugs.

$1,000 – A Paddle Forward T-Shirt, photo shout-out, your name in the credits, a copy of the documentary, several postcards from the river, biggest hugs ever, and my eternal gratitude.

$1,500 – A handmade knitted hat with a design of your choice, a Paddle Forward T-Shirt, photo shout-out, your name in the credits, a copy of the documentary, several postcards from the river, most ginormous hugs ever, and my eternal gratitude.

 The Impact

Upon returning, we will have the incredible opportunity to construct a local, regional, and national dialogue about the Mississippi River by creating a documentary of our experiences.  This documentary will spark conversations about our natural resources, water usage, the meaning of community, and the very nature of what it means to be "in nature."  I will connect with people, share stories, and inspire others to continue spending time outdoors.

Other Ways You Can Help

You might not be able to contribute, but that doesn’t mean I can’t use your help.  Please spread the word about our campaign by sharing this page via the web and word-of-mouth.

Send me a message if you think you have connections or information that may be helpful for us. We welcome your insights. 

Paddle Foward Tumblr

Paddle Forward Facebook

story:
{THE EXPLANATION IS IN FRENCH AND ENGLISH

L'EXPLICATION SE TROUVE EN FRANÇAIS&ANGLAIS}

I present myself, my name is  Leonard Abecassis, Owner of a patent, I am interested to launch this project first to contribute to the protection of our environment, as you are certainly aware, the prohibition of using plastic bags is turning global in order to block this curse that pollutes landscape and oceans, and secondly, to facilitate the daily lives of younger as well as older people who have difficulties to carry their shopping from their cars to home.  

French:

Je me présente, Je m'appelle Leonard Abecassis, propriétaire d'un brevet d'invention, je tiens a lancer ce projet d'une part pour contribuer a la sauvegarde de notre environnement car comme vous devez surement le savoir, l'interdiction des sacs en plastique se mondialise pour tenter d'enrayer ce fléau qui pollue les paysages et les océans et d'autre part, afin de faciliter, aussi bien la vie quotidiennes des jeunes que les personnes plus âgées qui ont des difficultés a monter leur course depuis leur voiture jusqu’à la maison.


Let's talk more about this functional foldable trolley:  

Parlons un peu plus de ce chariot pliant fonctionnel: 

Le 1er caddie a la fois pliable & écologique, Plus besoin de sac en plastique!!!

Le chariot se plie en un tournemain. Sa légèreté, sa robustesse et sa capacité de contenance lui permettent de transporter des charges très lourdes!


{Traduction en français en bas}

EcoloCart, the revolution of this trolley: a technical innovation for shopping trolleys lines!

Its 40 years of superior quality in the design of bags and shopping trolleys allows Ecolo-Cart to offer esthetic and modern, strong and ultra practical products.   

This European brand, working with a constant care of quality and innovation, Ecolo-Cart offers you functional and elegant products, rendering elegant and joyful shopping. 

This 4 wheels trolley will enable you shopping in lightness: no need to carry your shopping's difficultly! Furthermore, being esthetical and modern, it is hyper practical and has been conceived to be proved for your daily shopping's!   

This foldable trolley, handy, very light not cumbersome is easy to store and carry. Strong, owing to his framework in aluminum, comes with two 45 liters polyester bags each, and 4 wheels in order to facilitate overcome of sidewalk pavements and other ground encounters.

  Included: 2 big bags: 1 externalbag, 1 Base bag.   

We consider industrial manufacturing of a first series in order to supply our first clients and validate our concept toward investors. After several years of work in research and development we are calling to your contribution. We have worked without intermission:

Prototypes have been installed and tested with success by our first clients.

In order to improve it and launch it globally according to several studies conducted by our engineers and the manufacturing plant about 360,000 Euro are required.

Nowadays you may help us to overcome the pioneer difficulties – of this period while an idea for a solution may be developed and become a concrete marketable product.

Thanks to you, to your financial support, this ecologic trolley will may be soon on sales!

But only, AND ONLY IF dozens of other people will consider like you that this is a good idea, invest a sum according to their means and make the solution known in their network, then we shall be able to reach our aim. 

If it is a success, you will receive compensation and we shall obtain the funding.

Don’t forget that the smaller Euro amount will help in the finance of this project!

 Everybody may join in, so don't hesitate to use the indiegogo share tools in order to inform the maximum people about this project.

After travelling around the world and being aware of bets for a long lasting expansion, EcoloCart commits in the conception and marketing of products in harmony with its vision of a long lasting growth.

   •   Ecology : From today, think about tomorrow.

   •   Innovation: Do better with less.

   •   Human: Place mankind and its welfare in the focus of the meditation.

 EcoloCart works for the success of its project investing its time and energy … toward resolving a valuable catalyst solution for the surroundings and ease your every day life.

In cases, you interested this project, and you are an entrepreneur and you would like to join you, buy out , or help me launch this project that I can not launch already has more than 7 years, 

You can reach me on this email: leo.abk6@hotmail.com


EcoloCart, la révolution du chariot: Une innovation en matière de technicité et de ligne pour les chariot de marché!

Ses 40 ans d’excellence dans la conception de sacs et de chariots de course permettent à EcoloCart d’offrir des produits esthétiques et modernes, robustes et ultra pratiques.

Marque Européenne, œuvrant dans un souci constant de qualité et d'innovation, Ecolocart vous propose des produits fonctionnels et élégants, tout en rendant les courses chics et festives.

Ce chariot 4 roues vous permettra de faire vos courses en toute légèreté: plus nécessaire de porter vos achats à bout de bras! En plus d'être esthétique et moderne, il est hyper pratique et a été conçu pour être à l’épreuve de vos courses quotidiennes !

Ce chariot pliables, maniables, ultra-léger et peu encombrants , facile à transporter et à ranger. Robuste grâce à sa structure en aluminium,est équipée de deux Sac polyester 45 litres, chacun et de 4 roues pour franchir les bordures de trottoirs et autres surfaces..

• Fini les marques de sacs plastiques trop lourds sur les doigts

• Fini les caddies lourds à monter sur les trottoirs
• Fini les mal de dos
• Fini les allers retours de la voiture à la maison
• Fini les portes à retenir avec les pieds.
• Abolition de vos sacs plastique
• Pour une attitude responsable Bio
• Faire ses courses en consommateur responsable

Nous envisageons la production industrielle d’une première série pour servir les premiers clients et valider notre concept auprès des investisseurs. Après de nombreuse année de travail en recherche et développement, nous faisons appel à vos contributions. Nous avons œuvré sans relâche : 

Des prototypes ont été installés et testés avec succès chez les premiers clients.

Afin de pouvoir l’améliorer et le lancer dans le monde entier selon de nombreuses études qui ont été abouties par nos ingénieurs et l'usine de fabrication, il faudrait environ 360 000 Euros 

Aujourd’hui, vous pouvez nous aider à passer le « fossé du pionnier » : Cette période au cours de laquelle l’idée d’une solution peut être développée et rendue concrète.

Grâce à vous, à votre soutien financier, ce chariot écologique sera peut-être bientôt en vente !

Mais uniquement SI ET SEULEMENT SI des dizaines d'autres personnes considèrent comme vous que c'est une bonne idée, misent une somme selon leurs moyens et font connaître la solution dans leurs réseaux, alors nous pourrons atteindre notre objectif. 

Si c'est un succès, vous recevrez une contrepartie et nous obtiendrons le financement.

N'oubliez pas que le moindre Euro aidera a financer ce projet!

Tout le monde peut y participer donc n’hésitez pas a utiliser les outils de partage de Indiegogo pour faire connaitre se projet au maximum de personne.

Après avoir parcouru le monde et avoir pris conscience des enjeux pour un développement durable, Ecolocart s’engage dans la conception et la commercialisation de produits en accord avec sa vision du développement durable.

   •   Ecologie : Penser à demain, dès aujourd’hui.

   •   Innovation : Faire mieux avec moins.

   •   Humain : Placer l’humain et son bien-être au centre de la réflexion.

 Ecolocart œuvre à la réussite de son projet en investissant son temps et son énergie... vers le but de faire "tourner" un business créateur de valeur et catalyseur de solution pour l’environnement et pour vous faciliter la vie de tous les jours.
story_txt:
{THE EXPLANATION IS IN FRENCH AND ENGLISHL'EXPLICATION SE TROUVE EN FRANÇAIS&ANGLAIS}


I present myself, my name
is  Leonard Abecassis,
Owner of a patent, I am
interested to launch this project first to contribute to the protection of our environment,
as you are certainly aware, the prohibition of using plastic bags is turning
global in order to block this curse that pollutes landscape and oceans, and
secondly, to facilitate the daily lives of younger as well as older people who have difficulties
to carry their shopping from their cars to home.  
French:

Je me présente, Je m'appelle Leonard Abecassis, propriétaire d'un brevet d'invention, je tiens a lancer ce projet d'une part pour contribuer a la sauvegarde de notre environnement car comme vous devez surement le savoir, l'interdiction des sacs en plastique se mondialise pour tenter d'enrayer ce fléau qui pollue les paysages et les océans et d'autre part, afin de faciliter, aussi bien la vie quotidiennes des jeunes que les personnes plus âgées qui ont des difficultés a monter leur course depuis leur voiture jusqu’à la maison.


Let's talk more
about this functional foldable trolley:  
Parlons un peu plus de ce chariot pliant fonctionnel: 

Le 1er caddie a la fois pliable & écologique, Plus besoin de sac en plastique!!!
Le chariot se plie en un tournemain. Sa légèreté, sa robustesse et sa capacité de contenance lui permettent de transporter des charges très lourdes!

story:
THE MISSION

In the written words of: 

Tony Cerda, Chairman of The Costanoan Rumsen Carmel Tribe of California

The Mission of the Costanoan Rumsen Carmel Tribe of California, is to make people around the world aware of the lost Ohlone culture. We propose to do that with the purchase of sacred land of our ancestors at Monterey, California. Once the land is purchased and a model village is built we will extend an invitiation to everyone to come and experience the lost culture of our Ohlone ancestors through story, song, and dance. The village of the Ohlone will be built the way it was when the Spaniards arrived in 1769. We will build a modern facility that will appear to be an Indigenous dwelling. There we will provide a historical profile of the Ohlone through video, audio, and books. The Redwood sign as you enter the village will forever memorialize the names of the Indiegogo contributors who made it possible to PURCHASE THE LAND AND BUILD THE FIRST OHLONE VILLAGE!

OUR GOAL

In the written words of: 

Tony Cerda, Chairman of The Costanoan Rumsen Tribe of California

It has always been the goal of the Costanoan Rumsen Carmel Tribe to return to the sacred land of our Ohlone ancestors and build the first village of the Ohlone. Our ancestors were not as fortunate as other Indigenous people in the rest of the United States who maintained their culture into the early 1900’s. Our culture became extinct when the Spaniards arrived on the shores of California in 1769. I have spent a lifetime researching the village sites of our people. Over the years I would be asked:

“Why do you spend so much time gathering the history of the Ohlone?”

I always tell them:

"To let the world know that at one time a peaceful loving group of Indigenous people lived along the coast of San Francisco Bay through Monterey Bay to the lower Salinas Valley. Our people had no enemies."

WHEN THE CONQUERING SPANIARDS ARRIVED WITH A DOCUMENT (PAPAL BULL) SIGNED BY THE POPE IN ROME, DECLARING THAT ALL NEWLY DISCOVERED LANDS WERE INHABITED BY HEATHENS, THE OHLONE CULTURE CEASE TO EXIST. The Spaniards under the direction of Father Junipero Serra ordered the Ohlone villages burned. The Ohlone were marched off to build the California missions. The final blow came when our ancestors were forced to adopt Spanish surnames.

You could say:

“That was a long time ago, does it really matter? "

The answer is a resounding YES!

Yes because it was the Ohlone who contributed their labor and creativity to the advancement of the great state of California.

From the missions they went on to work in the gold fields and later to assist in building the great California agricultural empire. The history of the Ohlone must not be lost to another time. Our goal through the purchase of the Ohlone site at Monterey, California is to build the first Ohlone village and invite people from nations around the globe to come and experience the peaceful Ohlone way of life.

The Costanoan Rumsen Carmel Tribe of California is a verified 501(C)(3).

All contributions US-based are tax deductible.

 

THE OHLONE WERE MARCHED OFF TO BUILD THE MISSIONS FROM SAN FRANCISCO BAY THROUGH MONTEREY BAY TO THE LOWER SALINAS VALLEY.

THE HISTORY

The Ohlone people, also known as Costanoan, are a Native American people of the central and northern California coast. When the Spanish explorers and missionaries arrived in the late 18th century, the Ohlone inhabited the area along the coast from San Francisco Bay through Monterey Bay to the lower Salinas Valley. At that time they spoke a variety of languages, the Ohlone languages, belonging to the Costanoan sub-family of the Utian language family, which itself belongs to the proposed Penutian language phylum or stock. The term “Ohlone” has been used in place of “Costanoan” since the 1970’s by some descendant groups and by most ethnographers, historians, and writers of popular literature. Before the Spanish came, the Ohlone lived in more than 50 distinct landholding groups, and did not view themselves as a distinct group.

They survived by hunting, fishing, and gathering, the typical ethnographic California pattern. Originally, the Ohlone religion was Kuksu, but in the years 1769 to 1833, the Spanish Missions in California had a devastating effect on the Ohlone culture. The Ohlone population declined steeply during this period, when the Ohlone were marched off by the Spaniards to build the California missions.

The Ohlone living today belong to one or another of a number of geographically distinct groups, most, but not all, in their original home territory. The Muwekma Ohlone Tribe has members from around the San Francisco Bay area, and is composed of descendants of the Ohlones/Costanoans from the San Jose, Santa Clara, and San Francisco missions. The Ohlone/Costanoan Esselen Nation, consisting of decendants of intermarried Rumsen Costanoan and Esselen speakers of Mission San Carlos Borromeo, are centered at Monterey. The Amah-Mutsun Tribe are decendants of Mutsun Costanoan speakers of mission San Juan Bautista, inland from Monterey Bay. Most members of another group of Rumsen language, decendants from Mission San Carlos, the Costanoan Rumsen Carmel Tribe of Pomona/Chino now living in Southern California. Many of the members have relocated to their ancestral roots in the Monterey Bay area of California.

Most of the Rewards can be viewed in the Gallery.

Note: All rewards are unique in their own way. Each is handcrafted by the men, women, and children of the Costanoan Rumsen Carmel Tribe of California.

The Tribal members take great pride in authenticating the artifacts that symbolize the ancient Ohlone culture.

story:
Our current goal is to improve the infrastructure of the site and buy tools and materials necessary to run our first full length course "Think Like a Forest" in August 2013. 

Boodaville started in 2008 with the purchase of 1.5 hectares of olive terraces and pine forests in a stunning, tranquil location. Over the years, many people in an ever-growing international community have become involved and we've learned about, and applied, permaculture design during the development of the site. 

The long term goal is to create a working example of permaculture principles in action, including food production, comfortable rooms for guests and plenty of space for workshops and courses. In a nutshell, permaculture means that we will plan carefully to design hyper-efficient systems which make the most of natural processes, use few external resources, generate very little waste and are considerate of the local and global community. It will be a constantly evolving project as we move as close as possible to being truly sustainable while enabling others to change their own lifestyles and opening minds to alternative ways of seeing the world and relating to it. We see Boodaville as a pilot project to be replicated on small plots of land around the world, and are aware that, especially in Spain since the economic crisis, permaculture is becoming more and more popular.

The initial steps on this journey have already been taken, but "Think Like a Forest" will be our first intensive, full-length course. This crowdfunding campaign is designed to raise the funds necessary to fully prepare for the course, move the project forward more quickly and increase our capacity to share ideas and experience with others.

The specific funding aims are:

  • buy decent tools (including battery power tools, which can be charged on site with solar energy) so volunteers and course participants can work on the site infrastructure efficiently and quickly - £900 apx
  • buy the materials needed to undergo a practical project during our first full length course in August (the project will either be related to water collection or composting and improving soil quality) £300 apx
  • develop the infrastructure on site to be able to host 25 people for 7 days. Work includes improving bathrooms and toilets, building more furniture, improving the shade and indoor spaces, extending the range of kitchen equipment (£1000 approx)
 

(NB - the rest of the 3000 goes towards fees, and the costs involved in providing the perks)

If we pass our funding goal all the extra money will be used towards the longer term goals of the project. Here are some more ways in which we will spend money as soon as we have some!

  • Pay for the environmental impact assessment, which is the next vital step in applying for planning permission for the large building we have planned, where guests will have rooms, bathrooms and an indoor workshop/classroom space. (£700)
  • Buy materials to put the roof on the small house (£2000)
  • Put more time into sharing information about the project online, and marketing material (£200)
  • Start development of a water catchment system
  • Speak to the neighbours to arrange improving the access road and sharing the costs

All support is greatly appreciated, we hope that you like the rewards on offer and that many of you will be able to visit Boodaville some time!

More information about the perks:

See the photo gallery and your choice of prints

Information about the Boodaville Festival

Full information about the Think Like a Forest course in August 2013

Information about the Boodaville Sustainability Education Starter Kit

The music downloads are from three colours red and boodavile djs

story:
Preservation and production of organic seeds

Kitzia Kokopelmana, Earthsteward, seedswoman and culinary artist. Has devoted 15 years to the preservation of Botanical Diversity, combining teachings of world religions, art, gourmet food and organic gardening she explores all culinary, medicinal and useful crop possibilities into magnificent mandala gardens.

Kokopelmana Seed Sanctuary it is a Botanical Reserve of about 10 acres of land, with a river edge in a walking distance of Vilcabamba. It includes a fruit forest, native medicinal plants, bamboo forest and production fields.


This campain is to raise funds for the following:

* Irrigation supplies

As we expand the Seed production fields and the dry season is coming near we are in the need to set up a sprinkler system. This will cover an area of about 5 acres and will include 5 mandala gardens. $ 1000

* Soil amendments

We make our own compost to feed most fruit trees and the initial gardens, however as we expand, we need to purchase compost, worm casting humus and other soil amendments to improve the soil Seed production gardens. $ 2000

* Infraestructure

We currently have a 2 bedroom main house for the teachers with addicional bathrooms and large living room space for 40 people, yoga studio and sweat lodge area. Currently our students camp, however we envision building 4 tipis $1500 ea. = $ 6000.

* Maintenance and expansion

We have a weekly market that covers some of the basic expenses, however, as we expand we need additional labor for the next 6 months $ 6000.usd

We started with one acre of land last year and, as the demand for organic aclimatized seeds has grown and land has become available we envision to continue to grow, teach and produce seeds with your contributions.

The main goals of our seed production is to become self suficient and to share seeds with school and community gardens all over Ecuador.

DONATIONS

Your donations will be allocated to the projects being done at the moment we receive the donation, according to priorities (irrigation is urgent!)

BENEFITS

As a donnor, you will be getting updates of where your donations are going as i post pictures, videos and updates of the project in a daily/weekly basis.

You can also choose to invest on a tipi and be able to use it for a whole month, with two organic meals included (Only four tipis available, please request more information if you are interested)

The Impact

Currently we open the gardens every saturday to the general public, giving tours and workshops. With your contributions we will be able to increase the botanical diversity that is currently being preserved here. Your support will also help us to increase the volume of organic seed production that is shared in our community projects.

Having demostration sites for organic gardening and the production of organic heirloom seeds is very important for the creation of suatentability of our communities world wide.

Other Ways You Can Help

Visit our saturday organic market

Sign in for our workshops and apprenticeships

Please share this information with others

story:
This summer I will be part of a group of paddlers traveling down the Hudson River from Albany to NYC in order to raise awareness about the Two Row Wampum treaty, the first treaty between the Haudenosaunee Confederacy and European immigrants to North America.  As an ally and neighbor to the Haudenosaunee, I am excited to paddle with them in commemoration of the Two Row Wampum's beautiful vision of continuous peace, friendship, and shared environmental stewardship.  For more information about the treaty and this awareness campaign you can watch the short You-Tube video or visit http://honorthetworow.org/.

I am currently a student, so paying for the logistics of this trip will be challenging.  I need $200 to cover my basic participation costs.  All additional funds will be donated to the organizers to support general event expenses and education materials.

The indigenous nations of North America have long advocated for wise environmental stewardship.  This culture of respecting the land is especially important in light of the ever more urgent challenges of climate change, pollution, extinction, food security and social unrest.  As allies and neighbors it is important for us to stand in solidarity on environmental and social issues that impact all of the people who call this land home.  

Even if you can't assist me financially in participating in the long paddle, there are plenty of other ways that you can help.  More information for ways to get involved in the Two Row Wampum Renewal Campaign can be found at the following link: http://honorthetworow.org/what-you-can-do/

Thank you all so much for your attention and support.

story:
, recommends the following campaigns.

  Robot Dragonfly - Micro Aerial Vehicle 

  Misfit Shine: an elegant, wireless activity tracke

▲▲▲  Two examples for contribution of $ 5,000  ▲▲▲

 

What would happen to your campaign on this platform of collective financing? if together all of us, we make explode in everyone's lips to Indiegogo.

Have you ever wondered if you increase dramatically the number of people entering to Indiegogo, and give a look to your project, and therefore, make a donation to your campaign?.

The idea of this campaign on Indiegogo is to break the record of raising money of another project, presented at the Kickstarter platform, a project called; Pebble: E-Paper Watch for iPhone and Android, which achieved a funding  of more than ten million dollars, through nearly seventy thousand donors, and is the project most funded so far, through crowdfunding.

With your help, Bigger than a Goddamn Tesla Museum, will become the campaign to break all previous records, and it explodes in the head of all. Thus, in Internet be discussed about Indiegogo, and will be replicated in all social networks, groups, news media and blogs, pushing up the flow of visitors to Indiegogo, and thus increasing the probability of donations for all campaigns.

This campaign benefits all those who present a project on Indiegogo, and the world community at large, because with Indiegogo everyone can participate in a wider range of project, because the campaigns are done by people with different idiosyncrasies.

Think about it, contribute to this campaign even though you do not have an Indiegogo campaign is good for you, because it helps the whole world community. Indiegogo, unlike others, is the best crowdfunding platform because it is not restricted to a particular country or region, it is for everyone, for this reason the variety of projects in which you can help is very large.

Indiegogo promotes diversity, pluralism and participation.

The concept of: Bigger than a Goddamn Tesla Museum, is to concentrate all networks in this campaign, and exploit for the heavens to Indiegogo for the benefit of all.

Remember, if you have a campaign on Indiegogo, make a contribution to this campaign, or spreading the word on your network, or both, in this way, will be world news and will increase the participation of people in Indiegogo and your campaign will be successful.

Let's Build a Goddamn Indiegogo Campaign.

Other Ways You Can Help

Don't worry if you can't contribute, you can help me immensely by spreading the word, tell everyone about this initiative so they can do the same.

Please send the URL of this page to your Facebook friends, groups, colleagues, and family to pass along and get the word out.

campaign_city: Buenos Aires, Mar del Plata, Argentina

story:
We reached our intial goal of $2500- Now we are aiming for our ultimate goal of $5500.

---------------------------------------------------------

Update- May 22, 2013: Unpaving Begins!

 

Update- May 21, 2013: On TV

View a great clip about Park n' Lot on CBC News by clicking here

 

Update- May 17 , 2013: On the Radio

View a slideshow and listen to Park n' Lot on CBC Radio here.

 

Update- May 14, 2013: Park n'Lot 2.0 has news

On the 26th of April we were all working hard to clear the space and get it ready for the upcoming asphalt removal. Thank you to all who have worked to make this happen.

On May 1st 2013 thanks to all of you our campaign made it past our initial goal.  

Now we are working to get closer to the ultimate objective of $5500.

 

Where we are at now:

We have really moved forward in the process of preparing for this beautifying, educational and healthy environmental project. Students have spent laborious hours clearing the space and preparing it for the removal of the asphalt. After consultation with Benoit Dagenais, Director General of EnviroServices, it has been decided that after the asphalt removal, durable cedar planters would be built over the newly cleared land. The soil quality was not up to standards to operate an in ground garden. However, all the positive environmental outcomes of asphalt removal will be met and the PNL 2.0 team is happy with the new plan. We are going back to planters (we will make them out of sustainably harvested cedar wood…) and above ground urban agriculture.  We will still produce high quality food, organic, and local. We will also close the ecosystem loop by producing compost and using it on our beds.

We are just waiting for the asphalt removal crew to come and get that parking lot out of our park n’ lot!

___________________________________________________________________

Meet Park n' Lot 2.0

We are the Royal West Academy Environment Committee. In collaboration with our community partner organisation Action Communiterre, we have converted a former parking lot into a collective raised beds garden: The Park n’ Lot (PNL) Garden.

Our objective for 2013 is Park n'Lot 2.0- to remove the asphalt to create a ground garden coupled to a green space. 

The Park n’ Lot is a collaborative project-  an initiative of the school's students who reached out in the community by creating a partnership with Action communiterre- which employs the tools of sustainability and urban design to enliven the school grounds and the surroundings through the transformation of public space.

 

Before:

Phase 1.0:

 

Summer 2013:

 

In the original Park n’ Lot project, the parking lot was transformed by the installation of raised beds which has worked quite well until now... Because of the winter, the planters made of reused desktops have taken a toll.

After a democratic brainstorm session, we made up our minds. It is time to take this project further. It is now our mission to truly increase the amount of green space around the school and provide an edible school yard and a gathering space for the students and surrounding community...

It is time for Park n' Lot 2.0!

Why the Indiegogo Campaign?

The PNL 2.0 team has given itself the goal to have this project completed by September 2013. To do so, we have gathered significant support from the school community and have the benefit of the expertise and help of the professionals at Action Communiterre.

Our base goal is to raise 2500$ with this Indiegogo initiative. However, our total needs have been budgeted at 16500$ of which we have already raised 7000$. We are still expecting to receive answers from a few grant applications we have made (EMSB Green Policy Grant, WWF, Home Depot) and students are hard at work fundraising:

  • Selling raffle tickets for a pair of day passes to Osheaga
  • Selling PNL Project pins
  • Offering baked goods and cooked meals for donations at the Green Bean Café
  • Organizing a clothing exchange and sale “Friperie” style.

Your help would top it all up !!

Reaching the 2500$ goal would allow for the following to happen with the help of many volunteer students, parents and neighbours:

  • Removing, repairing and relocating of the raised planters currently on the space.
  • Removing of the asphalt and gravel filling underneath by a contractor.
  • Replacing of the asphalt with organic rich topsoil.
  • Shaping of the garden beds following permaculture principles.

Pushing to 3500$ would further the project by allowing:

  • Planting of fruit trees and vines to complement our already existing orchard.
  • Seeding and planting of edible garden plants (vegetables of all kinds, rice paddies, herb garden, etc.)

4500$ is getting us very close to our dream design by allowing:

  • The creation of an outdoor classroom space with flat rock seating and a pergola.
  • The creation of a landscaped bleachers area where students will be able to enjoy the space and be in contact with nature.

Finally, 5500$ would allow us to reach the final objective:

  • Using the space as a tool for an environmental education program which will include topics such as health education, science, arts, social sciences and extracurricular activities.
  • Hiring a horticulture expert from Action communiterre to offer animation in the garden for students and community alike.

 Other Ways You Can Help

Your contribution would be awesome but it is just one of so many ways you could help:

  • Help us get the word out about this campaign. Send this to anyone you know who may be interested in supporting us and local sustainable living. 
  • Join us in the garden as we build our dream (contact us for more details)
  • Join Action communiterre's membership and start gardening
  • Donate trees and plants, organic seeds or gardening material
  • Donate patio furniture for the space
  • Organize community oriented activites at the PNL
  • Discuss greening, gardening, food security, health and other issues related to the mission of the PNL project.

The Bigger Picture

The project has multiple environmental, social and educational impacts.

Removing asphalt and replacing it with permeable food production beds will decrease the urban heat island effect, increase water retention and drainage, increase biodiversity, reduce food millage, chemical fertilizers and pesticide use and capture carbon.

Cities are known to be hotter than natural settings because heat radiation becomes particularly intense when the sun’s energy hits the dark bitumen. Also, rain water that falls directly on asphalt rushes down directly to the city’s sewer system. This water sometimes collects chemical pollutants that either have to be treated or are directly dumped into the St-Lawrence river system. Moreover, this causes strain on the water treatment infrastructure, costing the city financial resources. Fostering biodiversity in the city is crucial to the well-being of nature and humans. Having a garden and green space instead of a bitumen desert provides a habitat for species, purifies water and air, controls pests and invasive species and helps attract pollinating insects and birds such as butterflies and hummingbirds. These are very important, free, ecosystem services.

The collective garden network Park n’ Lot is a part of an incredible social experiment. Providing an opportunity for people from the surrounding community to engage in urban agriculture, while working collaboratively with each other and sharing harvested food, the Victory garden network of Action communiterre has proven time and time again that people and plants can help make a community. Targeting people in a situation of food insecurity, using the tools of intergenerational and socio-economic mixity, the Park n’ Lot garden seeks to connect the school with the greater community in one space. Students, adults and elders all worked the raised beds in the past, sharing stories, gardening tips, languages, culture and experiences. The relationship between neighbours and the school has never been as good as it is now, thanks to Park n’ Lot.

The Partners

The Royal West Academy Environment committee:

(view website)

 

Royal West Academy's Environment Committee is made up of 25 dedicated students in grades 8 through to 11 who share the common goal of protecting our natural environment and living more sustainable lives in the city.

The committee is a forum and an action team for students who wish to learn and share about environmental issues. Our objective is to turn words into actions.

We currently have 10 active projects led by different members of the committee  (View a presentation of our mandate here):

  • The Park n’ Lot 2.0
  • Composting matters
  • Sustainable RWA (Waste management initiative)
  • Waste Reduction Week
  • The Green Bean Café and Green Bean cuisine
  • Earth Week
  • La Nuit Verte
  • The Bike Club
  • Outdoors crew (Nature outings)
  • Awareness, publicity and Green reporting

 

Action communiterre:

(view website)

Learn, Grow, Share

 Action Communiterre is a not-for-profit organization founded in 1997. We are dedicated to raising public awareness about food security and urban agriculture, while improving the community’s access to healthy organic produce through collectively-managed vegetable gardens and other urban agricultural projects in the Montreal area.

Cultivated by a diversity of neighbours, friends and gardening enthusiasts, the Victory Garden Network is a place where people come to learn, grow and share with one another. Gardeners use organic practices, divide the harvest among themselves and share a portion with other neighbourhood groups.

We invite you to come join us in the garden, or start something growing where you live. Together, we can build healthier neighbourhoods and more equitable, sustainable food systems.

Known as the Victory Garden Network in the NDG area, our 10 organic gardens bring local residents of diverse social and economic backgrounds together to garden, learn about food issues and share a portion of their harvest with the community. Five of our collective gardens are animated by knowledgeable staff that provide a variety of activities and workshops on subjects such as:

  • Organic gardening
  • Preserving and increasing biodiversity
  • Recycling & composting
  • Seed-saving
  • Balcony gardening
  • Nutrition
  • Medicinal plants
  • Environmental protection and empowerment in food security
  • Democratic life
  • Community involvement and the politics of food

To raise additional funds, Action Communiterre also offers its expertise to various organizations, businesses and individuals, and sells a large variety of unique heirloom and organic seeds, seedlings and plants.

Most of our gardens offer nature-based activities for children. Fun and educational for the whole family!

 

Royal West Academy

(View website)

Royal West Academy is an alternative high school with a limited enrollment. Its mission is to provide a structured milieu in which students are committed to academic achievement, bilingualism, computer literacy, an appreciation of the arts, an understanding of social issues and a sense of community responsibilities.

The staff and administration encourage the development of self-discipline, learning and interpersonal skills, a strong sense of responsibility and self-esteem in the students.

The goals of Royal West Academy are:

1)   To provide an atmosphere that encourages students to realize their potential and encompasses not only academic development, but also the social and physical well-being of students.
2)   To promote responsible actions, self-discipline, and mutual respect through a structured environment.
3)   To promote respect for cultural diversity and an understanding of social issues.
4)   To offer a curriculum enriched with accelerated content.
5)   To develop in all students the ability to function bilingually.
6)   To develop in all students the ability to use information technology effectively.
7)   To foster an appreciation of the arts.
8)   To provide continuity and support through a "Teacher-Advisor" system.
9)   To support students’ personal development through the compulsory extra-curricular program that includes athletic, cultural, environment and community service activities.
10) To provide a milieu in which parents, students and staff share the responsibility for achieving the mission and goals of Royal West Academy.

The committee is a forum and an action team for students who wish to learn and share about environmental issues. Our objective is to turn words into actions.
We currently have 10 active projects led by different members of the committee  (View a presentation of our mandate here):

The Park n’ Lot 2.0
Composting matters
Sustainable RWA (Waste management initiative)
Waste Reduction Week
The Green Bean Café and Green Bean cuisine
Earth Week
La Nuit Verte
The Bike Club
Outdoors crew (Nature outings)
Awareness, publicity and Green reporting

 
Action communiterre:

(view website)
Learn, Grow, Share
 Action Communiterre is a not-for-profit organization founded in 1997. We are dedicated to raising public awareness about food security and urban agriculture, while improving the community’s access to healthy organic produce through collectively-managed vegetable gardens and other urban agricultural projects in the Montreal area.
Cultivated by a diversity of neighbours, friends and gardening enthusiasts, the Victory Garden Network is a place where people come to learn, grow and share with one another. Gardeners use organic practices, divide the harvest among themselves and share a portion with other neighbourhood groups.
We invite you to come join us in the garden, or start something growing where you live. Together, we can build healthier neighbourhoods and more equitable, sustainable food systems.
Known as the Victory Garden Network in the NDG area, our 10 organic gardens bring local residents of diverse social and economic backgrounds together to garden, learn about food issues and share a portion of their harvest with the community. Five of our collective gardens are animated by knowledgeable staff that provide a variety of activities and workshops on subjects such as:

Organic gardening
Preserving and increasing biodiversity
Recycling & composting
Seed-saving
Balcony gardening
Nutrition
Medicinal plants
Environmental protection and empowerment in food security
Democratic life
Community involvement and the politics of food

To raise additional funds, Action Communiterre also offers its expertise to various organizations, businesses and individuals, and sells a large variety of unique heirloom and organic seeds, seedlings and plants.
Most of our gardens offer nature-based activities for children. Fun and educational for the whole family!
 
Royal West Academy
(View website)
Royal West Academy is an alternative high school with a limited enrollment. Its mission is to provide a structured milieu in which students are committed to academic achievement, bilingualism, computer literacy, an appreciation of the arts, an understanding of social issues and a sense of community responsibilities.
The staff and administration encourage the development of self-discipline, learning and interpersonal skills, a strong sense of responsibility and self-esteem in the students.
The goals of Royal West Academy are:
1)   To provide an atmosphere that encourages students to realize their potential and encompasses not only academic development, but also the social and physical well-being of students. 2)   To promote responsible actions, self-discipline, and mutual respect through a structured environment.3)   To promote respect for cultural diversity and an understanding of social issues. 4)   To offer a curriculum enriched with accelerated content. 5)   To develop in all students the ability to function bilingually. 6)   To develop in all students the ability to use information technology effectively. 7)   To foster an appreciation of the arts. 8)   To provide continuity and support through a "Teacher-Advisor" system. 9)   To support students’ personal development through the compulsory extra-curricular program that includes athletic, cultural, environment and community service activities. 10) To provide a milieu in which parents, students and staff share the responsibility for achieving the mission and goals of Royal West Academy.

story:
Eco-basket Summary

We care passionately about waste, the environment, and tasteful good-looking solutions to ecological problems. We’re two Britons living in Hungary: Scots artist Robin Sperling and English book publisher Mark Griffith.

New kinds of solar cells, farming plankton, making paper from hemp – there are dozens of exciting, ambitious developments happening right now out there.

But we want to do just one, simple thing.

We want to banish from ten million kitchens the smelly, hard-to-clean swing-top bin and its glistening sticky larval sac, the bin-bag. We want to replace this with free-standing eco-baskets made of recycled paper. They’ll be printed in tasteful designs that look good in any room, closed with drawstrings for tidy disposal. They’ll create a new market for rough recycled card, a cheap durable material in search of a use.

In homes across the developed world right now plastic swing-top bins squat in homes, ponging vaguely of rancid milk. Clusters of carrier bags stuffed with waste fester in corners. Trussed-up shiny bin-bags sag and loll, like half-deflated balloons of filth. With your help we’re going to replace all this ugliness with low-key organic eco-baskets printed in a big range of appealing, tasteful designs. Cheap, simple, elegant - they have to visually complement attractive homes. 

Neither liner nor bin, they’ll be smarter and greener than either.


How You Can Help Eco-basket

Our aim is to raise enough money to work with an experienced industrial designer who understands how paper printing and cutting production lines are tooled up.

We aim to raise 8,500 pounds, of which we’re budgeting 3,000 for the designer, 2,500 pounds for intellectual property fees so as to keep as much creative control of the project as we can once other firms and partners become involved, 2,000 for paid publicity and production of an art book chronicling the process from first designs to final signing, and 1,000 pounds for postal charges, phone calls, and other costs linked to sending out perks to our investors. 


If we fail to raise our target amount, we'll prioritise paying the designer for machine-ready drawings we can take to potential business partners - alongside spending enough to honour the perks we promised investors.


What Will It Change?

People think recycling and dealing with waste has to be utilitarian, earnest, austere. In a word, ugly. 

It doesn't. Good-looking homes deserve elegance in all things, even getting rid of trash. Once trash disposal is elegant recycling becomes easier, reusing waste becomes easier, thinking about our waste footprint becomes easier. 

    Risks & Challenges

    Risks are partial. If we do not raise enough funding and are unable to interest industry backers the basic risk is small. We raise a small amount and lose control of the project - but if someone else makes it happen, that's good too.   


      Other Ways You Can Help

      The most important way you can help apart from helping to fund us is by spreading the word. Pass this on and help us get people interested and excited about changing rubbish at home. Less plastic, more biodegradable paper, better homes.  

      Our world's environment, indoors and outdoors, is already thanking you.

story:
Aims of project

Our aim to show how the ancient Greek Mythology world can connect with modern, to develop unique place in Europe and restore one of the Seven Wonders of the World - a statue of Zeus.

The main aim of this project is:

- to promote Cyprus for overall global recognition, and to be one of the most visited & famous country in Europe;

- to reconnect the modern world with the wonderful aspects of ancient history, focusing primarily on Greek mythology. Visitors will have the opportunity to walk back in time, and learn more about Cyprus history and ancient Greek beliefs and ideals;

- to increase the flow of tourists, which will contribute to the development of such industries as hotel business, tourism, aviation, transport and sea transportation (cruises);

- to provide an opportunity to improve the quality of life of local population, especially in the villages such as Dora, Fasoula, Mamonia, Maronas, Kidasi, in the result improving their nearby environment, and providing more job opportunities.

- to give back to the environment by increasing more green parks and develop undeveloped secluded areas.

We are going to build a statue of Zeus, the father of Gods and king of all Gods in the Greek mythology, thereby we will recover the legendary statue of Zeus, which one was one of the wonders of the ancient world. The wonderful statue was devastated and robbed. To preserve the integrity of the statue, it was transported to Constantinople, where in the V century AD it was finally destroyed during a fire.

The park will also feature a well structured maze for visitors to walk through, where the visitors will have opportunity to see an amazing thing in the centre of the maze.

The project, including all materials and artistic works are protected by copyrighting.

The Construction Site

The construction site was chosen due to compliance with all the necessary criteria, including:

● located away from the sea, between the mountains, thus visitors will have the opportunity to explore and retire with the beautiful nature of Cyprus.

● get tourists to new parts of the island. Most tourists tend to be closer to their resorts, and closer to the sea. Our park will get acquainted tourists with the new places of Cyprus and the culture of the local population.

● to help local remote areas be better populated and develop local business to improve the quality of life.

Timeline

November 2016:  Initial discussion on building a theme park, featuring sculptures and a stone maze in Cyprus, due to the gap in the market for historic and fun tourist attractions. The team agreed and start to make designs of sculptures, drawings of the maze and the architectural plan of the park.

January 2017:  Final outlines of the design of statues completed by the project designers and architectures. The main scheme of the park is created.

April – June 2017:  Project animators and sculptors finish the 3D figures of each statue, allowing the further development of the final figures to be created.

July 2017:  The first view model of the park is completed.

September 2017: First part of plot is purchased for the project.

September – October 2017: The project, including all materials and artistic works is protected (copyright protection) by the International Lawyer Company CHRISTOPHOROS IOANNOU LLC.

November 2017: Amazing World website is launched - http://amazing-world.eu/. Signed agreements with a several Sculpture companies.

December 2017: Registered Business name “Amazing World” for the project, under registration number EE46816a.

January 2018: Started the process to purchase the second plot for the project.  

February 2018: Our lawyers contacted with the Funds of Archaeological Proceeds in Greece and informed them about the project. Our artists created unique drawings of "Zeus", which was made regarding of historical articles, books, informations.

March 2018: Our partners/sculptures finished some sculptures for the park.

March-April 2018: Architect makes the first drawings, with the collection of the documents, to be able to submit to state authorities and get a building permit.

May-June 2018: We started the cleaning works on our lands, to prepare it for construction works.

July 2018: All documents, drawings and applications were submitted to the Government by our Architect for the preliminary view, to be able to obtain a building permit.

WE NEED YOU

We are investing our funds to our project, but we are also looking investors to assist us with the execution of our plan.

WE NEED YOUR HELP to collect the rest amount to have possibility to finish our project as we planned and launch it on time.

We hope to your donation, if you don’t want to donate please help us to share our Indiegogo page with your friends.

We are confident that our unique ideas about the above-described project "Amazing World" park and our motivated and competent team will be an asset to Cyprus, which will have a positive effect of the country's economy.

LET'S MAKE CYPRUS UNIQUE AND MOST VISITED PLACE IN EUROPE.

story:
Climate Necessity

The Lobster Boat Blockade has provided an incredible opportunity for the climate movement to pursue a new legal tactic in our effort to push for immediate and dramatic emissions reductions. Ken and Jay are preparing to mount a "necessity defense" - potentially the first ever in the US climate movement. This is a powerful opportunity to showcase the seriousness of the climate crisis in a court of law, and put climate change on trial. 

  • Ken and Jay choose to take this action because they see no alternative - in both practical political terms and as a moral obligation. Ken has worked on climate change since 1989, as both a professional environmentalists and climate activist, and Jay has been an active citizen organizer working on climate since 2008. Neither have been arrested or charged with any crime before, and are good candidates for a watershed trial. 

  • Making a necessity defense means they admit their action and argue that the threat of passing the climate change point of no return is evident and immediate, the contribution of coal burning is clear-cut, available legal avenues for averting the crisis have been tried and are inadequate, and therefore, they were justified in taking action to directly prevent further injury.

  • Our expert witnesses include Dr. James Hansen, Bill McKibben, and Peter Parenteau and our legal team is headed by accomplished criminal attorney Joan M. Fund and climate legal expert Matt Pawa.

  • This could be the first time that a climate necessity defense is launched in the United States, providing a legal background and encouragement for a renewed wave of direct action around the country.

Could you step in to help this trial succeed as a model for the climate movement around the country?

What We Need & What You Get

We need to raise $10,000 to ensure that this trial is put to its best use.

  • Money will be used to pay travel and other expenses for experts testifying at the trial, for communication and documentation of the trial, banners and art supplies for trial festivities, and as a fund to help defray court costs and any fines that are levied.
  • Check out the awesome perks we have: custom art, dinner with Ken and Jay... or an awesome Life Raft!
  • In the event that the prosecutors drop the charges, funds will be used to further other climate legal defense work.

The Impact

There are substantial obstacles to presenting a necessity defense, but figuring out how to overcome them is important part of a national climate strategy. Merely advancing the argument in court will be a substantial achievement, paving the way for other cases, and provided a roadmap for use in other trials.

Unlike most attempts to mount necessity defenses, Ken and Jay have a very strong case. First, there is no question that we are facing real and imminent danger, with the world's most credible climate scientist, Jim Hansen to explain, and the recent report of the UN sanctioned Intergovernmental Panel on Climate Change as evidence.

Second, the action was taken with the explicit objective of launching a regional protest movement aimed at pressing Brayton Point owners and the Commonwealth of Massachusetts to shut the plant down immediately. The Lobster Boat action did jumpstart a regional protest movement and five months later, plant owners announced a shutdown. 

Finally, as individuals and supporters within a broader movement, Ken and Jay have pursued every legal avenue open to them to avert this crisis. They have lobbied, litigated, organized, campaigned, raised the issue in the electoral arena, promoted alternatives, educated the public and taken other actions to zero effect. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute money, that doesn’t mean you can’t help:

  • Plan to join us in court at the Fall River Justice Center this summer. We do not yet have a definitive trial date, but follow the blog and join the mailing list at www.lobsterboatblockade.org.
  • Use the share buttons on this page to tell your Facebook friends to support the trial!

Thank you so much for all you do, and for joining us on this journey!

story:
Short Summary

World Peace and Prayer Day, also known as Honoring Sacred Sites Day, was envisioned and brought forth by Chief Looking Horse as a day to join worldwide communities and people of all races, ages, genders, and faiths, who share concern for the welfare of the Earth and humanity.  This endeavor is committed to "All Nations, All Faiths, One Prayer" uniting in order to bring about healing to our mother Earth on behalf of future generations by working together.  It is highlighted by honoring-ceremonies, invocation, and prayer observed in collaboration with indigenous and religious representatives. Special guest speakers and wisdom keepers of all denominations share spiritual insight and discuss important environmental concerns and cures on both a local and global level. This profoundly auspicious time is elevated by a cross-cultural celebration of music, dance, and storytelling. All free of charge.

Chief Arvol Looking Horse is the 19th Generation Keeper of the Sacred White Buffalo Pipe Bundle and recognized spiritual leader of the Lakota, Dakota and Nakota Sioux Nations. Following the birth of a White Buffalo Calf in 1994,  Arvol Looking Horse was directed to honor the Four Directions with ceremony on Summer Solstice on June 21st. According to Lakota Star Knowledge, the birth of “Miracle,” a female white buffalo, signaled a time of Earth changes and the coming of The Mending of the Hoop of all Nations. The Summer Solstice is said to be a powerful time to pray for peace and harmony among all Living Beings. Grandmother Earth’s gifts: the air, water, plant, animal, and rock nations must be allowed to heal if we are to live in harmony with Her.

This year's event emphasizes two initiatives, a Call to Action based on the Council Statement on Fukushima, and the Sacred Sites Draft Resolution, which many peace workers are working to see adopted by the United Nations.
In keeping with solutions-based thinking, the WPPD 2014 event will include opportunities to learn about sustainable living models such as permaculture and wilderness skills and ways for all ages to become reconnected with the Earth.

Representing the horse nation, Blue Star Equiculture will lead a sacred horse ride with 15 horses from their home base in Palmer, Massachusetts to the World Peace and Prayer Day site in Wappingers Falls, NY.  Blue Star Equiculture is committed to sustainable equine husbandry. See links for more details. 


World Peace and Prayer Day / Honoring Sacred Sites Day
is a continuing, 19-year-long project of the Wodakota Foundation.

Blue Star Equiculture is a co-sponsor of this event.


***Cover photo taken at Rio+20 United Nations Conference on Sustainable Development 2012 by Ivan Kuxxaan Sum.***


What We Need & What You Get

Humanity is at the Crossroads, and the importance of the energies created by our event cannot be underestimated. In order to see World Peace and Prayer Day 2014 become all it can be, our committee must raise the necessary funds for the travel and lodging expenses for our revered elders and wisdom keepers from around the world, the park costs, and all related expenses for the promotion and logistics of the multi-day gathering for possibly thousands of visitors. Due to the sacred nature of this event, we must maintain that entry and attendance is free to the public.

We have a varied collection of perks to serve as gestures of our appreciation for your assistance in bringing forth World Peace and Prayer Day 2014. Several are one-of-a-kind handmade items created by highly skilled Native craftspeople. Others allow you to spend time with some of our elders in return for your kindness.  


The Impact

Ancient prophecies throughout the world have predicted this time...when population growth, over-consumption, depletion of our natural resources and pollution would severely damage our Earth’s life-sustaining capabilities. It has become Chief Looking Horse’s personal commitment as the “Keeper of the Sacred Bundle” to assist in the mending of the Hoop of all Nations. Besides his work with his own community, meeting with global and spiritual leaders around the world and speaking and offering prayers at universities and environmental symposiums (including the United Nations). Chief Looking Horse’s mission with World Peace and Prayer Day has already made tremendous contributions to the progress of Earth Awareness and World Peace. Every year the imperative grows and the effects of the ceremony reverberate to all relations and into the future. 


Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that you may not be in a position to donate funds. However, you still can play a critical role in making World Peace and Prayer Day 2014 a reality.

****You may donate ANY monetary amount, however large or small, not only the levels that are listed with perks.

****Please help raise awareness for the event by sharing through your social media networks! This not only will help us raise the needed funds, but will connect more like-minded people everywhere to the need to be as one mind on and around the summer solstice, further raising the global consciousness.

****Please attend the event itself in the beautiful Hudson River Valley at Bowdoin Park, in Wappingers Falls, NY.  It is open to the public and is free of charge. Please come with an open heart and intentions for peace and healing toward all our relations.  We thank you in advance for your cooperation in that certain protocols will be followed by all attendees to maintain the integrity of the gathering. Please refer to the link to the WPPD website for more details.  http://worldpeaceandprayerday.com/

****Gather with others at sacred sites around the world on the summer solstice; connect with the water, the land, and other beings wherever you may be.

****Send a prayer or peaceful intention regarding the healing of our natural world, harmonizing with our relations and protecting our future generations.
 
                 WE THANK YOU!  Mitakue Oyasin, All Our Relations

rock nations must be allowed
to heal if we are to live in
harmony with Her.




	
This year's event emphasizes two initiatives, a Call to Action based on the Council Statement on Fukushima, and the Sacred Sites Draft Resolution, which many peace workers are working to see adopted by the United Nations.In keeping with solutions-based thinking, the WPPD 2014 event will include opportunities to learn about sustainable living models such as permaculture and wilderness skills and ways for all ages to become reconnected with the Earth. Representing the horse nation, Blue Star Equiculture will lead a sacred horse ride with 15 horses from their home base in Palmer, Massachusetts to the World Peace and Prayer Day site in Wappingers Falls, NY.  Blue Star Equiculture is committed to sustainable equine husbandry. See links for more details.  World Peace and Prayer Day / Honoring Sacred Sites Dayis a continuing, 19-year-long project of the Wodakota Foundation.Blue Star Equiculture is a co-sponsor of this event.***Cover photo taken at Rio+20 United Nations Conference on Sustainable Development 2012 by Ivan Kuxxaan Sum.***What We Need & What You GetHumanity is at the Crossroads, and the importance of the energies created by our event cannot be underestimated. In order to see World Peace and Prayer Day 2014 become all it can be, our committee must raise the necessary funds for the travel and lodging expenses for our revered elders and wisdom keepers from around the world,  the park costs, and all related expenses for the promotion and logistics of the multi-day gathering for possibly thousands of visitors. Due to the sacred nature of this event, we must maintain that entry and attendance is free to the public.We have a varied collection of perks to serve as gestures of our appreciation for your assistance in bringing forth World Peace and Prayer Day 2014. Several are one-of-a-kind handmade items created by highly skilled Native craftspeople. Others allow you to spend time with some of our elders in return for your kindness.   






The ImpactAncient prophecies
throughout the world have
predicted this time...when
population growth, over-consumption, depletion
of our natural
resources and pollution
would severely damage our Earth’s life-sustaining
capabilities. It has become
Chief Looking Horse’s
personal commitment as
the “Keeper of the Sacred
Bundle” to assist in the mending of the Hoop of all Nations.
Besides his work with his
own community, meeting
with global and spiritual
leaders around the world
and speaking and offering
prayers at universities and
environmental symposiums
(including the United
Nations). Chief Looking
Horse’s mission with World
Peace and Prayer Day has
already made tremendous
contributions to the
progress of Earth Awareness
and World Peace.

				Every year the imperative grows and the effects of the ceremony reverberate to all relations and into the future.  Other Ways You Can HelpWe understand that you may not be in a position to donate funds. However, you still can play a critical role in making World Peace and Prayer Day 2014 a reality.****You may donate ANY monetary amount, however large or small, not only the levels that are listed with perks. ****Please help raise awareness for the event by sharing through your social media networks! This not only will help us raise the needed funds, but will connect more like-minded people everywhere to the need to be as one mind on and around the summer solstice, further raising the global consciousness. ****Please attend the event itself in the beautiful Hudson River Valley at Bowdoin Park, in Wappingers Falls, NY.  It is open to the public and is free of charge. Please come with an open heart and intentions for peace and healing toward all our relations.  We thank you in advance for your cooperation in that certain protocols will be followed by all attendees to maintain the integrity of the gathering. Please refer to the link to the WPPD website for more details.  http://worldpeaceandprayerday.com/****Gather with others at sacred sites around the world on the summer solstice; connect with the water, the land, and other beings wherever you may be. ****Send a prayer or peaceful intention regarding the healing of our natural world, harmonizing with our relations and protecting our future generations.                   WE THANK YOU!  Mitakue Oyasin, All Our Relations

story:
Why we need your support

The regulator has released the Bermuda Better Energy Plan for public consultation. This may be the only chance to show that it is supported by the people of Bermuda. We have already invested considerable resources into developing the Better Energy Plan. We need your help so we can continue to: 

  • Develop the technical and economic feasibility - there are opportunities to make elements of the plan even more robust. Estimated budget: $4,000
  • Promote the plan in Bermuda to ensure the consultation gets widespread support. Estimated budget: $2,500
  • Answer technical questions and explain the plan in person - we would like to engage with the regulator, the energy company and the community to make sure the plan works for everyone. Estimated budget: $3,500
  • Bring technical experts to Bermuda - we would like to bring experts in offshore wind and energy storage from abroad. Estimated budget: $7,000

Your help could change the direction of Bermudian energy generation forever. This is a unique opportunity to help Bermuda use her own energy resources, drastically cut carbon emissions, and make electricity more affordable.

 

Background

Bermuda's energy regulator has asked the island's power company, BELCO, to submit a plan for the future of electricity generation on the island. The plan that has been released proposes continuing to generate electricity primarily from expensive and polluting imported fossil fuels. Fortunately, Bermuda's laws provide an important opportunity to influence BELCO's plan by allowing other organisations to submit alternative plans.

Bermuda Engineering Company Limited (BE Solar) commissioned UK sustainability firm Etude to prepare a more sustainable plan: the Bermuda Better Energy Plan. This plan maximises use of Bermuda's own abundant renewable energy rather than imported fossil fuel. Your support will greatly increase the chance that the energy regulator asks BELCO to update their original plan to include aspects of the Bermuda Better Energy Plan, by enabling us to continue our work to develop, communicate and promote the plan. If we are successful this will lead to a fantastic change through which energy efficiency, solar panels, offshore wind and energy storage all contribute to a massive reduction in CO2 emissions of more than 60% by 2038.

This would also result in less money being spent on energy imports, more local jobs in renewable energy and more money for Bermuda’s local economy. It is preparing the island for the future and will help to produce more affordable clean electricity.

 

What we can offer

Your contribution to create a better energy future for Bermuda will be recognised as follows:

More than $50 - Option to be listed as a supporter at the back of the final Bermuda Better Energy Plan report and on website.

More than $500 - Option to include a logo or picture on the supporters page at the back of all Bermuda Better Energy Plan publications and on website.

More than $1000 - Listed as a sponsor with  logo at the beginning of Bermuda Better Energy Plan publications, and at the top of the supporter page in a prominent position with a larger logo, and on the website.

 

Who we are

Etude are a team of engineers based in London and are experts in energy policy, sustainability and energy in buildings.

BE Solar are an established solar installer in Bermuda. They invested their own money into commissioning the Bermuda Better Energy Plan and are strong promoters or renewable energy, energy efficiency and sustainability on the island.

 

Our commitment 

The funding and donations will go directly to Etude for working on this project. We acknowledge this is a large responsibility and commit to undertake all our work on a non-profit basis. We commit to complete transparency and we will publish all costs on the project (including detailed time sheets and cost breakdowns). We will work hard to ensure that exceptional value is delivered.

 

Read the Bermuda Better Energy Plan

You can read the Bermuda Better Energy plan on our website www.betterenergyplan.bm or by direct download here:

Bermuda Better Energy Plan - Short summary

Bermuda Better Energy Plan - Full report

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Your input and support would be fantastic to support our campaign. Here are some other ways you can help:

  • Respond positively to the consultation. Keep an eye on www.betterenergyplan.bm for details.
  • Publicise our website and Indiegogo fund raiser through your own networks.
  • Share the Indiegogo campaign on social media.

Thank you for reading. Please don't hesitate to contact us if you would like more information.
