story:
For the last 25 years I dived in the Caribbean and, as all other divers and snorkelers, I witnessed the destruction of coral and the beautiful world it protects and nourishes. 

The coral reefs are the biggest ecosystem on earth but they will disappear if nothing is done. It is only with pictures that we will be able to show our children how was the beauty of the ocean. This simple but extremely perturbing fact provided my first motivation to create and develop the Coral Peace project. We invite you to view a video made by Conservation International that summarizes beautifully the need for a special attention to coral reefs: 

http://natureisspeaking.org/coralreef.html.

Coral reefs are living, dynamic ecosystems that provide invaluable services: they acts as nursery grounds for 25 to 30% of all marine fishes and invertebrates, provide natural storm barriers for coastlines, purify carbon dioxide from the atmosphere, are potential sources for pharmaceuticals, and are also the ocean garden. Already 20% of the coral reef has disappeared as the result of pollution from industrial waste, sewage, chemicals, oil spills, fertilizers, runoff from land and sedimentation produced by climate change, acidification, destructive fishing practices and, in the Atlantic, the invasion of the lion fish (pterois). Researchers believe that coral reefs and the marine creatures that rely on them may die off within the next 50 to 100 years, causing the global extinction of a worldwide ecosystem. Coral Peace organization has been founded to face this challenge by applying innovative techniques to maximize coral growth using middle underwater sub-aquatic nursery. Within a year we can transplant more than 3000 pieces of coral on the reef.

What is Coral Peace?

Our mission is restore piece by piece the coral reefs with the development of an ecotourism strength. 

The objectives to meet this mission are to :

- Create an interest to the tourists to be a part of the construction of coral reefs by offering them the possibility of planting their piece of coral.

- Create a website on which they will follow the development of their reef.

- Create an exhibition to raise consciousness of the current state of the marine life.

- Raise awareness amongst local residents of our new mission to protect the new coral reefs.

- In the longer term, create a worldwide competition for the creation of the most beautiful coral garden pioneering

Coral Peace is a determination to rebuild and reconstruct the reef. The first project will be launched in Dominica “The Nature Island”, in the Caribbean. Dominica is the best place to start the first project; this country is not oriented toward massive tourism, with only propeller airplane landing on the island, reminding you, with the dense rainforest on your left side, the movie Jurassic Park 3. In addition to unique diving sites, the island receives trekkers for their 365 rivers, fresh water lakes, falls, National Parks and protected Forest Reserves, covering almost one-third of the island.

The Coral Peace team is a coalition of determinate people dedicated to the rebuilding of the reef. Under the guidance of a project manager, commercial divers provide the expertise for the construction of the sub-aquatic nursery designed based on innovative techniques developed by world-renowned researchers, while instruction divers insure the maintenance of the installation. The promotion team focuses on developing an ecotourism force to self-finance the continuity of the project in partnerships with local communities, businesses and decision-makers.

What your money will do?

Coral Peace works in association with dive centers of the island dedicated to the health of the ocean. Our first project in Dominica will be elaborated with The Anchorage Hotel, Whale Watch and dive center located near the capital of Roseau. Our organization installs the sub-aquatic infrastructure and the ground lab, teaches and trains local diving instructors and personnel for the protection and the techniques of cutting and transplantation. We construct and elaborate an interpretation center for tourists, primary and secondary schools of the island, we do the promotion of the dive center as an eco-responsible organization and finally for the eco-responsable gifts.

The Coral?

It is important to note that all the coral grown by Coral Peace will be transplanted in the ocean; no coral will be for sale. 

Coral Peace also works with collaborators and we are proud to announce that Ms. Céline Cousteau is ready to promote our project with CauseCentric Productions.

For the first project, we need from Indiegogo financial campaign, $250,000 for the shipment of the material and tools, the commercial divers, the training, the promotion, the elaboration and construction of the interpretation center and your reward gifts. If we achieve our goal and reach more, the amount will be allocated to start another project on another island in the Caribbean. Finally, the more we receive, the more coral will grow in the ocean. We are a small organization with no infrastructure and employees to support, 95% of the money will be applied on the coral development and on awareness raising initiatives and 5% on administrative costs..

Coral Peace may seem a drop in the ocean but it is a good one. Many have talked about the importance of coral reefs, Coral Peace is ready to act.

story:
My Story

I operate Zoltan's Flow bench(a cylinder head porting and performance carburetor shop and also freelance as an auto body restorations artizan). I am developing the ZOLECO ECO EXOTIC SPORTS CARS using my philosophy of efficiency with performance , conservation and practicality.

The Impact

The Zoleco will be a completely hand crafted futuristic and unique Jetson's like automobile.

By using the teardrop shape and combining that with every low drag innovation that we know about the Zoleco design architecture will allow fuel economy increases of up to 80%.

This campaign is about funding the production prototype.

To this point I have developed the full size hands on design model. This is not just a computer generated image....it is the concepts foundation from which the production prototype will be built.

What we need

I have exhausted all my personal , family and friends funding that was available to get the development model phase completed.

All the money raised here will go toward the production prototype. The goal of this next phase is to achieve 150 MPG at cruise speed and be able to reach 150 MPH flat out.

Why so fast you ask?....This will prove without the shadow of a doubt just how extremely important aerodynamic efficiency is for the future of our personal transportation. For more details of on going innovations see our website WWW.zoleco.ca.

Where the money will be spent

  • labour sources    

  • wind tunnel testing

  • chassis dyno testing

  • one oem engine

  • one race prepared engine 

  • data logging system

  • carbon fibre/kevlar body

  • 3 dimensioal spaceframe chassis

  • custom paint job mosaic with all the supporters names included

  • glass and custom acrylic  windows

  • one oem transmission

  • one high geared transmission

  • racing seats and harnesses

  • full underbody venturi

  • high speed wheel and tires

  • fuel system

  • wiring and gauges

  • suspension and brake components

  • materials

  • shop rental for the eight month build 

  • performing the ZOLECO CHALLENGE on the Bonneville salt flats.

story:
Why are we doing this?

Beautiful and intriguing designs appear in the crop fields in Wiltshire each year in greater numbers than anywhere in the world.

Summer 2013 is a make or break year for crop circles in the fields of Wiltshire, England, the epicentre of the phenomenon. Crop circles are appreciated by people all over the world. However they arouse frustration and anger amongst farmers as their crops are also damaged by those who visit them. 

        

©Steve Alexander            ©Olivier Morel                 ©Steve Alexander

Crop circles attract visitors from all over the world, many of whom visit each year. There are few, if any, ways the affected farmers benefit from this - honesty boxes for donations collect trivial amounts and are often stolen and the farmer’s crop is damaged by the crowds that visit.

One farmer estimates his losses at about £10 000 per year and the money collected in honesty boxes as about one tenth of that. Farmers are angry with the lack of respect for their land and rights.

Farmers are faced with difficult times and bad weather. Many farmers have now reached the point of zero tolerance and have promised to cut out all formations this season as soon as they become aware of them.

By raising these funds through this crowd funding appeal and by the sale of access passes so we can provide real recompense to the affected farmers, we intend to turn this situation around.

We aim to prevent this downwards spiral by organizing a sustainable and proper system of respect and compensation for the farmers through access pass sales,  and crowdfunding.

This year is critical, but with your help we can save the circles.

         

 ©Olivier Morel               ©Eva Marie Brekkesto      ©Lucy Pringle

Why do we need this much money and where does it go?

There are an average of 40 formations a year in Wiltshire and each formation results in the loss of at least £500 to £1000 in value, depending on the size and the crop.

If we manage to raise more than £36 000, we will be able to save more formations that might appear.

All money from Access Passes and from the CrowdFunding Campaign or other sources will go directly to the affected farmers. This will be managed by a company set up for the purpose and whose management board will include farmers.

   

©Monique Klinkenbergh    ©Janet Ossebaard         ©Steve Alexander

What you get for your support:

For your donation you will get either a day, week or season crop circle access pass to go and see the crop circles.

If you are unable to visit the crop circles there are other rewards you will receive when you support this campaign.

  • There are a collection of high definition photos of past crop cirlces you can download and use for your personal purposes.
  • You can choose to receive a special painting by well known local artist , Sue Faux, of a crop circle of your own choice. These come in different sizes and include postage to anywhere in the world.
  • You can opt to take a flight above the crop circles in a light aircraft, helicopter or hot air balloon. Once you make the pledge you can contact us to arrange a day and time for this to take place.

Extra bonuses

  • A free mobile app to receive notifications of latest crop circles and related information.
  • A website, www.cropcircleaccess.com bringing you up to date information on the latest crop circle formations inlcuding photos, maps, newsletter etc
  • An information and co-ordination centre and shop that you can personally visit in Woodborough, Wiltshire where you can view maps, magazines, DVD‘s and talk to people about the latest crop circles.

    
      Day Pass £7.50            Week Pass £20            Season Pass £40

Who we are:

The Crop circle Co-ordination and Information Centre is a non-profit social enterprise based at the Woodborough garden centre near Pewsey in Wiltshire.

The centre incorporates the Silent Circle Venue.

We would love to see you at our new information centre.

  • Download our mobile app to be notified immediately of new Crop Circle when they appear.
  • Buy a day, week or season access pass to see the Crop Circles.
  • Look at maps that show you how to enter formations, where to park, and if access is permitted.
  • Be notified of talks and workshops.
  • Be able to send us a photo of a new Crop Circle.
  • Sign up for a Crop Circle newsletter
  • Free WiFi, computers and Cinema Corner
  • and much much more....

                    
     Monique Klinkenbergh                      Derek Viner              

Download our Free Mobile App

iPhone 4, iPhone 5, iPad, Android, and mobile website versions have been designed.

Currently the Android app is available in the Google Play store. The iPhone app has now been approved by Apple and is available in the iTunes store. Use the search term ‘Crop Circle Access‘                                                             

                    

         iPhone APP                                           Android APP

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Spread the word about our campaign to all your friends via FaceBook, Linkedin, Twitter, email, Foursquare, Instagram and Pinterest or any other way you can.
  • Encourage people to come and visit our Information Centre
  • Sign up to our newsletter to be kept updated
  • Engage us on FaceBook with your opinion.
  • Come to one of our talks or workshops.
  • Submit photos of crop circles you visit for us to use in research.

Indiegogo have lots of sharing tools you can use! 

Many thanks for your support.

Monique Klinkenbergh and Derek Viner

There are a collection of high definition photos of past crop cirlces you can download and use for your personal purposes.
You can choose to receive a special painting by well known local artist , Sue Faux, of a crop circle of your own choice. These come in different sizes and include postage to anywhere in the world.
You can opt to take a flight above the crop circles in a light aircraft, helicopter or hot air balloon. Once you make the pledge you can contact us to arrange a day and time for this to take place.

Extra bonuses

A free mobile app to receive notifications of latest crop circles and related information.
A website, www.cropcircleaccess.com bringing you up to date information on the latest crop circle formations inlcuding photos, maps, newsletter etc
An information and co-ordination centre and shop that you can personally visit in Woodborough, Wiltshire where you can view maps, magazines, DVD‘s and talk to people about the latest crop circles.

          Day Pass £7.50            Week Pass £20            Season Pass £40
Who we are:
The Crop circle Co-ordination and Information Centre is a non-profit social enterprise based at the Woodborough garden centre near Pewsey in Wiltshire.
The centre incorporates the Silent Circle Venue.
We would love to see you at our new information centre.

Download our mobile app to be notified immediately of new Crop Circle when they appear.
Buy a day, week or season access pass to see the Crop Circles.
Look at maps that show you how to enter formations, where to park, and if access is permitted.
Be notified of talks and workshops.
Be able to send us a photo of a new Crop Circle.
Sign up for a Crop Circle newsletter
Free WiFi, computers and Cinema Corner
and much much more....

                         Monique Klinkenbergh                      Derek Viner              
Download our Free Mobile App
iPhone 4, iPhone 5, iPad, Android, and mobile website versions have been designed.
Currently the Android app is available in the Google Play store. The iPhone app has now been approved by Apple and is available in the iTunes store. Use the search term ‘Crop Circle Access‘                                                             
                    
         iPhone APP                                           Android APP


Other Ways You Can Help

Spread the word about our campaign to all your friends via FaceBook, Linkedin, Twitter, email, Foursquare, Instagram and Pinterest or any other way you can.
Encourage people to come and visit our Information Centre
Sign up to our newsletter to be kept updated
Engage us on FaceBook with your opinion.
Come to one of our talks or workshops.
Submit photos of crop circles you visit for us to use in research.

Indiegogo have lots of sharing tools you can use! 
Many thanks for your support.
Monique Klinkenbergh and Derek Viner

story:
Help Us Get to PowerShift!

We are a group of Reed students that are dedicated to leading our peers to make our campus more sustainable. We want to attend PowerShift, the world's largest and most influential youth climate conference, to gain knowledge and skills to kickstart this endeavor.

Meet Our Group

  • Shannon: the signator of Reed's environmental group (Greenboard) and a Sierra Student Coalition fall fellow
  • Rennie: student body Senator
  • Dove: Reed's first Student Sustainability Coordinator
  • Austin, Helen, and Maya: signators of Reed's community garden
  • Allison: who is being commissioned by Portland's Bureau of Land Planning and Sustainability for her Environmental Studies - Econ thesis
  • Mia and Sam: seasoned activists and leaders on campus
  • Salish, Stuart, and Alexis: active members of Greenboard
  • Nick: an outdoor enthusiast

The Numbers

Here's our budget:

  • Each student is showing their personal investment by paying the conference's registration fee themselves.
  • A two-way plane ticket from Portland to Pittsburgh is about $500, meaning that our funding goal of $3000 will send six students!

The Impact

We are committed to using this experience to effectively carry out at least five on-campus projects intended to reduce energy use and increase long-term sustainability in the canyon, the gardens and beyond. We have also firmly committed to hosting a series of workshops that will engage the Reed community in the lessons we have learned at the conference with the intention to plan and carry out even more sustainability projects. We expect Power Shift to give us the skills, knowledge and connections to return the investment to our community long into the future

story:
Short Summary

I am passionate about permaculture and urban gardening. This year I am starting a business called Earth Magic Permaculture which will offer edible landscaping services as well as eco education. Part of doing this is creating a learning garden in my backyard. The Learning Garden will be a place where people can learn hands-on permaculture skills such as garden design, how to attract pollintaors, composting, and more! I am determined to green the suburbs in my city.

One aspect of The Learning Garden that I am really excited about and need support for is urban beekeeping. This spring and summer I hope to set up bee hives and begin to do urban beekeeping. A lot has to go into that: workshops, equipment, the hives, and, of course, the bees! I am trying to raise $600 to support this aspect of the Learning Garden. 
   
This was going to be part two of my campaign but because money was not raised for the course I wished to attend, it is now part one!

What We Need & What You Get

The courses I wish to take will cost me $150 and the rest of the money raised will go towards equipment, hives, and BEES! I feel $600 is the minimum I need to raise to pursue this (not $1300, I am not able to change the fundraising goal).

You will get lots of great perks plus I invite everyone to come and visit my bees once I get them set up. I will happily share my knowledge with you!

 The Impact

I feel I have a calling to help create green cities and suburbs. Climate change means that people need to make big changes right now. We simply can't wait for governments and corporations to make those changes, it has to come from the grassroots. That's why I am setting up The Learning Garden - I want to create a place where people can come to learn and explore and hopefully be inspired!

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute, that's ok! You can help me by promoting my campaign on your facebook, twitter, and other social media. Thanks!

story:
^Like BEE!^                             ^Tweet BEE!^      ^Email BEE!^

Short Summary

BEE (Bicycle for Everyone's Earth) is a collective of environmental campaigners for sustainability, slow living, and environmental awareness.  Since 1997 our main activity has been the annual BEE Ride; a 2-3 month long self-supported cycle tour from the most northerly to southerly town on Japan’s four main islands. The team is made up of an international group of volunteers who teach about environmental sustainability during the ride. Over the years, BEE Japan teams have consisted of riders from all over the world committed to the concept of thinking global and acting local.  This year we have a rider hailing from USA (TX) and two lovely ladies from Kyoto and Ishikawa, Japan. You can find out more about us on our home page.  The BEE Ride uses both direct action and environmental education to demonstrate viable lifestyle alternatives.

BEE Japanは自然環境問題の啓蒙活動をしてい る日本人・外国人混合のグルー プです。　BEEという名は、「Bicycle for Everyone’s Earth」の頭字語で、サイクリングを大気を汚染しない効率的な交通手段として促進しています。サイクリスト達は８月に北海道を出発した後、２，３ヶ月かけて屋久島まで日本縦断旅をします。

「環境にコミットしたい」そんな想いから自動販売機は使わずに、ベジタリアン食を食べ、その土地の生産物を買って、地域を応援しながら旅をします。さらにオーガニック食品を食べる運動をしたり、貧しい国でのフェアトレード商品を育てることを目指しています。

THE BEE Impact

Our DIRECT ACTION includes:

* Travelling the length of Japan exclusively by bicycle　自転車で日本を縦断します
* Eating low on the food chain (Vegetarian)　ベジタリアン生活をします
* Choosing organic products whenever possible　自然食品を選びます
* Supporting local economies by buying local produce　地元で採れた食材を選びます
* Avoiding chain stores and convenience stores, and using no vending 　machines.　コンビニ、自動販売機は使いません
* Minimizing waste by choosing less packaged products, buying reusable, recycled and recyclable items, and using no waribashi or other disposable eating utensils.　割り箸や使い捨てプラスチック容器、おしぼり等は使わず、マイ箸、マイ皿、マイハンカチを使います。

The 2012 BEE Japan Ride will begin in early August and finish in October.  Along the way riders will stop in local communities in order to hold educational presentations, support local economies, and host various clean-ups.  We are following an Eastern route through Tohoku region this year for volunteer work with www.tonomagokoro.net.  We also look forward to visiting schoolchildren affected by the nuclear incident in Date City, Fukushima.  We are also riding in solidarity with the current popular movement against nuclear power; BEE has always been in favour of clean, renewable energy and we hope to demonstrate through our activities a range of practical, everyday solutions to reducing energy consumption.    

2012年のBEEＪａｐａｎＲｉｄｅは8月前半に始まり、10月に終了する予定です。旅の途中で、学校等でプレゼンテーションを行ったり、地域経済を支援し、地域の方々と交流をします。今年度は、遠野市まごころネット（www.tonomagokoro.net）にて東北のボランティア活動を行います。そして、福島にも訪問し、原発問題にも向き合います。BEEは清潔な再生可能エネルギーを常に支持しています。私たちの活動によってエネルギー消費削減の解決策になることを望みます。

What We Need & What You Get (PERKS!)

We aim to be self supporting on the ride, camping and staying with friends, and will rely on our own resources as well as the generosity of BEE sponsors, friends and hosts along the route.  Our purpose is primarily educational, however we do aim to raise a significant sum to donate to our beneficiary Japan for Sustainability. This grassroots NPO shares BEE's core values and work tirelessly year round to promote sustainable living and provide practical help to struggling communities.

私たちが必要とするものとあなたが得るもの（ＰＥＲＫ（右のボタンをクリック！！））
私たちはキャンプ生活を通じ、地球の支援を行います。旅先でのBEEスポンサー、友達およびホストの優しさは私たち自身の資源（源）になります。私たちの目的は主として環境問題を広めていくことです。私たちはTシャツやジャージを売り、その収益を日本のＮＰＯに寄付します。

In return for your support we have put together a range of perks to say a BIG Thank You! These include shout outs and postcards from the road, original prints and posters created by BEE members and friends, and some BEE couture in the form of t-shirts and jerseys. Click the "Gallery" tab to see some pictures of T-shirt design, jerseys, sticker/poster, etc.

Check out all our PERKS on the RIGHT and pick your favorite!

あなたの応援・支援（ＰＥＲＫボタンのクリック）を心から感謝いたします。Tシャツ、ジャージ、ポスターはBEEメンバーや仲間によってデザインされています。Tシャツのデザイン、ジャージ、ステッカー・ポスターなどの写真は「Ｇａｌｌｅｒｙ」のタブをクリックしていただければ見ることができます。
「PERKS」をチェックして、ご購入・ご支援をお願いいたします。

Other Ways You Can Help 

There are many ways that you can support BEE; we value friendship, solidarity and practical support.  If you live in Japan perhaps you can help us with food, equipment  or accommodation along the way; if you share our passion for environmental action and education you may be able to help us organise an event in your community.  If you live further afield or are not equipped to help us on the road, we appreciate your support and encouragement through our homepage, facebook page and twitter account.  Spread the word on your social networks and help us to reach a greater audience than ever!

他の方法でも支援することができます
BEEを支援する多くの方法があります。私たちは友情、繋がりを大事にしています。暮らしの中で食物、設備など生活を見直すことで私たちのサポートになります。環境上のアクションをあなたが起こすことで、私たちだけでなく、あなた自身、地球の為になります。私たちのホームページやFacebookにてコンタクトが取れます。ぜひ私たちの活動がこれまでより素晴らしいものになるためにご協力・支援をお願いいたします。

story:
The Plan

Have you ever seen "A Bug's Life"? Here's a short synopsis if you haven't: an ant called Flick goes out into the world to find warrior bugs to defend his colony from a horde of freeloading grasshoppers.

Sound familiar? Well it should. Right now the natural gas industry is corrupting our political process, wrecking communities and sealing a disastrous fate for humanity. So, like Flick, a group of us from Rhode Island, Connecticut, New York and West Virginia are going out into the world (well, ok, only as far as Pennsylvania) to meet with other  activists and organizers. We want to learn from them and, more importantly, create lasting relationships we can use to organize against the natural gas industry. 

We will be arriving in Northeast Pennsylvania on January 26th and departing on January 29th. During this time we will be meeting with organizers who will be coming in from across Pennsylvania, touring fracking well sites, dreaming big and strategizing about next steps.

The Situation

Right now the natural gas industry has an iron grip on the American political system and is poisoning not just the planet, but also the minds of the general public with its propaganda. Republicans and Democrats alike are fighting for a natural gas future and new fracking wells are being drilled daily across the country. 

Despite Superstorm Sandy, despite the well documented poisoning of water wells near fracking sites, despite all evidence that climate change is threatening our species very existence, the status quo of corporate greed continues unabated.  The only thing that will result from this is more tainted water supplies, a climate catastrophe and greater suffering. 

But we still have time. Time to learn from each other and time to build a movement capable of winning justice for impacted communities, and stopping the fossil fuel industry. Our community in New England may not be under the threat of fracking, but natural gas power plants and pipelines crisscross the landscape. This is not the legacy we want to leave to our children and grand children. 

But we need your help. We need funds to get to Pennsylvania to meet these other activists. As funders of this project, you will play an important part in shifting the national discussion around natural gas and help create the sorely needed counterbalance to the gas industries multi-million dollar PR campaign.

Our Needs

Our  needs for this trip are pretty basic. Our budget of $1850 will cover our travel to Pennsylvania, the travel costs of other organizers coming from other parts of Pennsylvania, meals, a donation to our hosts and small stipends for  some of the organizers. 

Our budget of $1850 breaks down like this:

Travel costs: $750 - Organizers will be converging from New York, West Virginia, Rhode Island, Connecticut and from across Pennsylvania.

Meals: $400 - There are going to be a lot of people to feed!

Organizer stipends: $400 - We feel people should be paid for their hard work. 

Donation to our hosts: $200 - We want to be good guests and compensate those who are housing us.

Indiegogo and Paypal fees: $100

Most  of us going on this trip are volunteers in the movement to resist the  fossil fuel industry. We’re going on this trip with the intention to  build a more just world and to help other people. By donating to us, you  are sharing in this intention and laying the foundation for long term  resistance to the natural gas industry.

Other Ways to Help

If you are unable to donate to this trip, please help spread the word by sharing this page via Facebook, email, twitter or any other social media!

Virginia, Rhode Island, Connecticut and from across Pennsylvania.Meals: $400 - There are going to be a lot of people to feed!Organizer stipends: $400 - We feel people should be paid for their hard work. Donation to our hosts: $200 - We want to be good guests and compensate those who are housing us.Indiegogo and Paypal fees: $100Most 
 of us going on this trip are volunteers in the movement to resist the  
fossil fuel industry. We’re going on this trip with the intention to  
build a more just world and to help other people. By donating to us, 
you  are sharing in this intention and laying the foundation for long 
term  resistance to the natural gas industry.Other Ways to HelpIf
 you are unable to donate to this trip, please help spread the word by 
sharing this page via Facebook, email, twitter or any other social 
media!

story:
On Saturday, June 25th, 1pm at Foley Square, No Frack NY Coalition is holding a rally to tell Governor Cuomo to BAN FRACKING IN NEW YORK STATE. We are taking on the oil and gas companies to preserve our water, land and air from all gas and oil drilling. This is part of a Statewide Day of Action Against Fracking


No Frack NY needs your help to make this rally a huge success.  We need art supplies for flyers, posters, banners, ribbons and signs to let our message be seen. We need sound equipment and a sound person to let our message be heard loud and clear. We also need need funds for van rentals, logistical and other expenses. 


Please support this rapidly growing movement against fracking and drilling and be a part of telling Cuomo that we won't stand for gas companies fracking up New York, poisoning our water, destroying the Catskills and forever changing the landscape and quality of New York State.


Fracking is the process of extracting methane (a potent greenhouse gas, sometimes called "natural gas") or oil by drilling into the earth and injecting millions of gallons of water mixed wtih toxic and dangerous chemicals. Fracking would destroy farmland and the peace and beauty of upstate New York. Fracking poses a serious and unacceptable risk to our water supply - contamination of the water table is toxic and irreversible. Along with this contamination, fracking accidents occur regularly and the results are evacuations and the further poisoning of land, air and water. This is the water we drink, bathe in, and give our children, and the beautiful upstate farmland that provides us with fresh, local food,


Our demands include a permanent ban on fracking and the use of fracking by-products, the implementation of green jobs (particularly for upstate NY), the replacement of fossil-fuel and nuclear energy by renewable, clean energy sources, energy conservation, and support for local farming and agriculture.


Confirmed speakers include Josh Fox (Director of Gasland), Wenonah Hauter (Executive Director of Food & Water Watch) and Scott Stringer (Manhattan Borough President), Tony Avella (NY State Senator). We have a quickly growing list of co-sponsors which can be seen at our web site, along with more information about the dangers of gas drilling and fracking.


Let's inspire the nation and the world by standing up to the huge energy interests who would spoil our water, air and land. We say now is the time to conserve and move to renewable energy.


This rally can only happen with the hard work of committed volunteers and your generous donations. Wherever you are located, please support us!

story: As a class project in Professor Evans' Conservation Biology course  this semester at Sewanee: The University of the South, we are studying how the demand for palm leaves by churches on Palm Sunday has created a market for illegally harvested palm leaves from the rain forests of Belize. We have learned that this "palm connection" is precipitating the loss of biodiversity in Chiquibul National Park, one of the last great rainforest preserves in Central America. Each of us produced a video that traces different facets of this connection and each highlights the excellent work of the Belizean non-profit organization, Friends for Conservation and Development (FCD) that is leading efforts to solve this complex problem. The goal of our class project is to generate awareness of the "palm connection" to the loss of rainforest biodiversity in Belize and raise money to support FCD. So please help us by donating today!

story:
The first fully integrated and connected Pet wellbeing solution in the market. 


  • Activity Tracker - Monitor and compare your Pet's exercise levels from anywhere. 
  • Pet Food Dispenser - Feed your pet remotely with the right quantity of food, and connect to the webcam to check him. 
  • Data Cloud - Compare your Pet's exercise and weight with other pets the same age, breed and neutering state, and connect to other pet owners.


The American Animal Hospital Association (AAHA) - clearly states that in order to "keep your Pet Healthy and Happy" you should "Design a diet and exercise plan to meet your pet’s specific needs".

We want to make this possible and more accessible through an integrated system that balances exercise (energy expenditure) with food intake (energy consumption). We want pets to be happier and healthier, and to make that possible by providing owners with systems that enhance the understanding of their loved ones, and tools that enable them to take closer care of them, wherever you or they might be.


You've just returned from a longer-than-usual walk with your dog, but aren't sure how much extra nourishment they might need … and when your cat keeps staring at the food box, is that because they're still hungry from an all-night walk, or just being greedy? 

With approximately 80 million US cats and dogs assessed as overweight or obese, and 12 million UK pets overfed with fatty treats, pet obesity epidemic is one of the biggest welfare issues affecting our pets today. (2012 US National Pet Obesity Survey and UK PDSA Animal Wellbeing Report 2012)

Using the latest technology in accelerometers and gyroscopes, we have developed a tracking device that attaches to your pet’s collar, collecting complete data on their activity.

Connected wirelessly to our Cloud Services, the Activity Tracker contrasts this data with your pet’s specific breed and age, letting you know whether your pet is getting the right amount of exercise for their target range whilst providing you with feeding advice.






Secure, comfortable and adaptable to any dog or cat collar – our device’s small internal battery lasts for 6 months, so you don't have to worry about frequent recharging.


Spontaneous after-work drinks, travel delays, a meeting that’s overrunning, a last-minute confirmation about that date you were hoping would happen… 

Modern life means it’s not always easy to be where you initially planned. Keeping your pet's weight and health in check means a balanced diet: The right amount of food at regular times, with the right amount of exercise.

Running on pre-programmed information about your pet’s specific nutritional programme, the Food Dispenser will ensure that your pet always gets the right amount of food, at the right time, and as often as it needs - throughout the day.

At the tap of a finger you can command the system to dispense food to your pet. You can access the dispenser’s secure webcam link to make sure everything is running as smoothly as it should. You can activate the dispenser-microphone, to listen to them. You can even trigger its loudspeaker function and talk to your pet through its meal. Make sure your pet always eats in company – right from your mobile phone application.


Connected to the Activity Tracker device, the feeder will use live data to recalculate the exact quantity of food your pet needs based on their calorie expenditure over the last 48 hours.




It can be hard to give your pet the close attention it needs, monitoring and cross-checking both activity and feeding patterns. Your vet may need specific information on their recent behaviour to make an effective, detailed diagnosis. Observation of abnormal activity, when you aren't physically nearby, can help detect a potential health problem. 

The Otto Cloud Services transform a wealth of data into specific, practical advice for you and your companion. Exercise levels are relayed to you through digestible graphs, downloadable as reports to share with your veterinary professional. Information on your pet's breed, age, weight and food brand will be configured into an individual feeding programme - with no need to weigh out - and this can be tailored even further by live data from the Activity Tracker. These calculations are all done by the intelligence of the Cloud system, yet you maintain complete access and management control through your personalised web page, tablet and mobile applications.


We partnered with the wonderful team at LFLECT (www.lflect.com) - led by Elena Corchero, former MIT Media Lab Europe Researcher and alumni Central Saint Martins MA Textile Futures - to create a series of rewards to our Indiegogo backers and supporters.


LFLECT is a British brand for high end visibility products. Winner of the "Best use of Materials" award by "BluePrint" at 100% Design Competition.

With LFLECT you can safely take your dog for a walk or let your cat venture outside. The reflective characteristics of the products will give high visibility to your pet and warn incoming cyclists or cars.

If you back us with more than 79£ you will be amongst the first people in the world to get their hands on the Otto Petcare Systems devices, and have the opportunity to become part of the Founding Club.



Nuno Santos - Team Leader 

Digital Strategist and Innovation Lead, Partner at BrandEmotivity. Advised for some of the largest brands on Innovation and Digital Disruption. Grew-up having dogs as part of the family, and got used to different types of breeds and their different habits and personalities. 

Laurent Cuzin - Marketing / Social 

Entrepreneur with more than seven years experience in founding and launching new businesses and products. Keen eye on design and user experience. Pet lover, founded the first european social network for pets' parents - Woopets - back in 2007. 

Mark Brill - Mobile Technologies

Mobile strategist, innovation consultant, lecturer. Chairs the Direct Marketing Association's Mobile and Connected Marketing Council, and Senior Lecturer in Future Media at BCU (futuremedia.me). Mark grew up very much as a dog lover - his family had two Cocker Spaniels. As an adult he switched his allegiance to cats, at one point living in a house with 13 of them. He is particularly obsessed with online felines, especially cat-based memes, which he tries to include in as many of his presentations as possible.

Stefan Wessels - Tech Officer

More than fifteen years experience in design and technology for web, mobile applications and gaming. Co-founded BrandSense, a sensors and algorithms innovator based in Singapore. Shared a childhood and back yard with close friends in the form of two Staffordshire Terriers, raised many puppies, been bitten by a Rhodesian Ridgeback and is looking for a yard big enough to keep a dog (and kid) happy.

Alex Crampton - Operations

Alex is a senior theatre Director and Producer. Vast experience in managing complex teams and skill sets to get projects done on tight deadlines. Doting owner of a very skittish, affectionate, and permanently confused cat, called Oreo. 

What we have done so far:

  • Detailed concepts and design; 
  • Activity Tracker prototyping; 
  • Activity testing with different pets, data results analysis;
  • Final designs and 3D prints of the Activity Tracker and Food Dispenser casings; 
  • Testing of the different components;
  • Set-up the production planning and meetings with production stream companies; 
  • Business planning and funding backers.

What will we be doing going forward:

December-January

  • Indiegogo Campaign Industrial Production Planning and Quantities Review; 
  • Cloud Services - set-up and cross device optimisation; 
  • HTML5 – Front-end development and optimisation; 
  • App Development - iOS App development, Android App planning.

February

  • Shipping the Indiegogo Rewards – Thank you for the LOVE;    
  • Confirm the quantities for the Activity Trackers and Food Dispensers first production runs; 
  • HTML5 front-end Finalise Development; 
  • App Development - iOS App development beta, Android App start; 
  • Packaging - start packaging production.

March and April

  • Hardware Certification for the dispenser - submission for worldwide certification; 
  • Food Dispenser Quality Control – Tests of the different separate parts and visits to the factories checking quality and ethical production; 
  • Activity Tracker Quality Control – Test the accelerometers and the casings resistance and durability; 
  • Cloud Services – Testing with different devices connection for live camera quality, data visualisation and social features; 
  • Logistics - optimise logistics and distribution, North America, EU, Asia; 
  • App Development: iOS finalised and submitted to Apple Store and Android App Beta; Packaging: 
  • Produce retail packaging, and test the “Opening Experience”.

May

  • Delivery of the Activity Trackers and start shipping worldwide; 
  • Food Dispenser Product Testing - finalise industrial prototype testing, test connection to the Cloud Services.

June

  • Delivery of the Food Dispensers and start shipping worldwide; 
  • App Development: release Android in Google Play; 
  • Celebrate with our Supporters on exclusive events in London and San Francisco.

Thank you.


Risk And Challenges

Production issues may arise that can accelerate of delay Otto PetCare Systems devices production and certification.

The rewards for the pledges that are not Otto systems components have no electronics, and will be delivered as soon as logistics permit.

The Activity Tracker mass production does not offer substantial challenges in terms of production and shipping, however, we work our planning based on the estimated delivery by the activity tracker supplier of the casing and electronics.

The Food Dispenser can suffer from delays if lead-times from different manufacturers affect the final assembly and certification. By using reliable manufacturers and components and electronics, we trust the planning proposed.

We will keep in constant communication with our supporters and warn them, and the market, as early as possible, of any unforeseen changes to this planning.

Every year Turtle poachers in El Cuco steal 50,000 Turtle eggs to be eaten in the local restaurants and we need your help to stop it!

Hi, I'm Tom from La Tortuga Verde, a Turtle conservation centre and resort on El Cuco Beach, El Salvador.

When I came here in 2005 I was shocked and appalled that nothing was being done to stop the stealing and eating of turtle eggs. Right then and there I decided something had to be done, so I built La Tortuga Verde. 

Our mission is to give every single turtle a chance at life.

We've made huge progress with the poachers but now we need your help.

We want to buy all of the turtle eggs for the whole year and get them out of the soups in the local restaurants and back into the sea where they belong! 

We need to raise $12,500 to buy all the 50,000 Eggs laid on El Cuco beach this year.

  • For as little as $5 you will save 20 baby turtles.
  • Using our custom built turtle sanctuary we make sure they get the best start.
  • Check out our incredible perks and get so much back from your donation.
  • Make a real visible difference the these amazing creatures lives.


Using the La Tortuga resort we've been making incredible progress with the locals and the poachers, but we need to stop this awful trade completely, using your donation, we'll be able to make a dramatic change to the turtle population, the eco-system and the people who live here.

  • Last year La Tortuga Verde bought 25,000 eggs.
  • We have a dedicated team of full time conservationists and volunteers who work around the clock to save these precious animals.
  • We're now working with injured Pelicans and making progress to stop the Illegal culling of iguanas.
All the money made at the La Tortuga resort goes back into helping the local eco-system and helping the locals create a sustainable financial base.
Last year we spent our money on the rescue and release of over 25,000 turtles and 5 Pelicans, but we can always do more, your money will help us spend more money and time on training, education and facilities to care for these endangered creatures.

In 2009 the government in El Salvador passed a conservation law that meant a blanket ban on the collection, selling or consuming turtle eggs. In reality this is almost never enforced.

The poachers openly walk the beaches at night, waiting for the turtle to lay the eggs, collecting and then selling to local restaurants. While protecting coastlines is the best way to stop the trade, with less than 3% of coastlines and 1% of land protected, in El Salvador this just wont work. If we don't buy these eggs, THEY WILL ALL BE SOLD.


At La Tortuga we understand that life is hard for El Salvadorians, that's why we employ 50 locals and pay them a fair wage. We also use the resort as an opportunity to train our employees to care for the welfare of all animals.

We have decided that a hands on approach to conservation has a direct impact on the future of conservation in EL Salvador so we encourage to all our guests at La Tortuga Verde to get involved directly in the conservation process in the hope that they will help us to make a big difference in their communities.

We also host a national TV show all about going green, conservation and sustainability, the first of its kind in El Salvador. We know that taking this step into the mainstream will help the future generations of El Salvadorians think responsibly about the environment they live in.

We understand that some people just dont have the money to contribute financially, but there are so many more ways that you can help!

Get social

Share our campaign with those that care, it takes just a couple of minutes to get on facebook or twitter and post to all your lovely followers! 

Come to La Tortuga Verde

We run a fantastic volunteering program which let's you get hands on and stuck in! 

Make a difference in your own community

Can't make it to El Salvador, no problem, why not start up your own conservation program, this could be as simple as litter picking or planting your own herb garden.

Thank you so much for looking at our project, if you have any questions please let us know and we'll be happy to have a chat!

Take a look at our brand new festival Equilibrio taking place at La Tortuga Verde happening in 2015. Free tickets and ticket discounts are included in the $5 and $600 perks.

Terms and Conditions:
To claim perks, please email latortugaverderest@yahoo.com, and let us know your name and the amount you've donated so we can make sure that you obtain the correct perk on arrival.
Free rooms are limited to one per week.
If you would like a shout out on twitter please email us at the above address with your twitter name.
If you wish to appear in the TV show, please let us know so that we can notify you of filming dates. We can't guarantee that you will be in the final edit.
Equilibrio festival tickets are limited and the discount is only available on the full ticket price - Contributors cannot claim the discount.
Free rooms and discounts on accommodation does not apply during holidays, if you're unsure of when these are please contact us first.

story:
Summary

The Gifford Pinchot Task Force  (GPTF) is a registered 501(c)(3) based out of Portland, OR and Vancouver, WA that passionately supports the biological diversity and communities of the Northwest through conservation and restoration of forests, rivers, fish, and wildlife.

The GPTF maintains a number of key values in our stewardship of the 1.32 million acres of the Gifford Pinchot National Forest:

  • Thriving biological diversity supports the high quality of life in the Northwest and is embodied by healthy runs of fish, diverse functioning forest ecosystems, clean drinking water, and inspirational recreational experiences to all those that visit the forest.
  • The Northwest is one of the best places to demonstrate that conservation and restoration can support thriving local communities. The habitats, biodiversity and groups of regional business and contractors with forestry and watershed expertise present a wide array of collaborative opportunities to preserve a healthy, diverse, and working forest.  
  • Open and sincere collaboration with local community members, government, policy officials, and other organizations is absolutely our preferred approach to addressing issues of conservation.
  • We have a committed responsibility to efficiently and carefully utilize the valuable financial resources entrusted to us. 

Mount St. Helens is one of the most iconic mountains and active volcanos across the globe. Established as a National Volcanic Monument for research, recreation and education on August 27th, 1982 by President Ronald Reagan, Mt. St. Helens' continued volcanic activity positions it as one of the world's premier working laboratories for geological, environmental, and biological research. Coupled with the millions of acres of surrounding public lands and rivers, Mt. St. Helens is a treasured scenic, recreation, and cultural resource that belongs to all of us. 

The mountain, however, has been threatened by international mining interests. In early 2010 a Canadian corporation, Ascot Resources, purchased mineral rights and is now seeking to conduct exploratory drilling just outside of the National Monument and 12 miles from the crater. The United States Forest Service approved a drilling plan in 2010 without undergoing an environmental assessment (EA) of the project and in response the Task Force filed a complaint in federal court in 2011 asking for a full environmental review of the exploratory drilling project.  U.S. Senator Maria Cantwell supported our efforts with a letter to the forest service and United States Bureau of Land Management.  

Our ongoing efforts to prevent hard rock drilling on Mt. St. Helens continues as Ascot Resources continually eyes the site as mineral prices continue to change.  If Ascot were to drill and find viable resource deposits on Mt. St. Helens, the land would be sold off to a much larger corporate open-pit mining operation.   

What We Need & What You Get

Here's a little more information on specifics:

  • The GPTF is hoping to raise $60,000 to fund full time staff and programmatic work to proactively track, research, and be involved in all aspects in opposition of the proposed drilling.  These funds will allow the GPTF to continue ongoing legal research on land management, resource, and mineral law, in addition to providing us the resources to act as advocates of the communities and regional lands in court.  As the drilling issue continues indefinitely, we are seeking funding so that we may be as prepared as possible to prevent any widespread mineral extraction near Mt. St. Helens and in our national forest. 
  • As a group of passionate, committed and conservation-minded citizens, we actively provide conservation and restoration programs throughout the Gifford Pinchot National Forest.  Our ability to prevent hard rock mining on Mt. St. Helens will ensure that this beautiful and fragile ecosystem will remain intact so that it may thrive and be enjoyed by all those who visit, hike, study, and recreate on our public lands
  • If our aggregate funding goal is not met, the donated funds will go directly to ongoing conservation work on Mt. St. Helens and within the Gifford Pinchot National Forest.  Please visit our website to view our work. 

The Impact

How your generous contributions will help:

  • Mining and drilling within a national forest and in such close proximity to a National Monument poses environmental, economic, and social detriment to local communities, and runs contrary to the intended use of the Gifford Pinchot National Forest and Mount St. Helens National Volcanic Monument.
  • Mining and exploratory drilling (the utilization of hydraulic fracking fluid, blasting, high-temperature refining)  pose an unacceptable risk to streams and drinking water, impacting public health, agriculture, and fisheries.
  • Ascot Resources, a foreign corporation, stands to reap all the profits, leaving people, animals, and ecosystems downstream with a legacy of pollution.
  • Mining and drilling in this iconic and fragile area would threaten the clean water, abundant wildlife and unspoiled beauty the region is known for, compromising local quality of life and our economy.

Other Ways You Can Help

Can't contribute? Want to know and do more?  Check out ways you can be involved!:

  • Check out our website for more information on the mine and our other ongoing restoration and conservation work!
  • Like us on Facebook and follow us on Twitter for updates and information! 
  • Take a look at our volunteer page for ways in which you can be involved with Mt. St. Helens! 
  • Contact your federal legislators: let them know hard rock drilling in national forests and near National Monuments is unacceptable 
  • If you're close by, take a hike out to Mt. St. Helens and take in the magnificence of the volcano and the beauty of the surrounding lands

And that’s all there is to it.

The mountain, however, has been threatened by international mining interests. In early 2010 a Canadian corporation, Ascot Resources, purchased mineral rights and is now seeking to conduct exploratory drilling just outside of the National Monument and 12 miles from the crater. The United States Forest Service approved a drilling plan in 2010 without undergoing an environmental assessment (EA) of the project and in response the Task Force filed a complaint in federal court in 2011 asking for a full environmental review of the exploratory drilling project.  U.S. Senator Maria Cantwell supported our efforts with a letter to the forest service and United States Bureau of Land Management.  
Our ongoing efforts to prevent hard rock drilling on Mt. St. Helens continues as Ascot Resources continually eyes the site as mineral prices continue to change.  If Ascot were to drill and find viable resource deposits on Mt. St. Helens, the land would be sold off to a much larger corporate open-pit mining operation.   
What We Need & What You Get
Here's a little more information on specifics:

The GPTF is hoping to raise $60,000 to fund full time staff and programmatic work to proactively track, research, and be involved in all aspects in opposition of the proposed drilling.  These funds will allow the GPTF to continue ongoing legal research on land management, resource, and mineral law, in addition to providing us the resources to act as advocates of the communities and regional lands in court.  As the drilling issue continues indefinitely, we are seeking funding so that we may be as prepared as possible to prevent any widespread mineral extraction near Mt. St. Helens and in our national forest. 
As a group of passionate, committed and conservation-minded citizens, we actively provide conservation and restoration programs throughout the Gifford Pinchot National Forest.  Our ability to prevent hard rock mining on Mt. St. Helens will ensure that this beautiful and fragile ecosystem will remain intact so that it may thrive and be enjoyed by all those who visit, hike, study, and recreate on our public lands
If our aggregate funding goal is not met, the donated funds will go directly to ongoing conservation work on Mt. St. Helens and within the Gifford Pinchot National Forest.  Please visit our website to view our work. 



The Impact
How your generous contributions will help:


Mining and drilling within a national forest and in such close proximity to a National Monument poses environmental, economic, and social detriment to local communities, and runs contrary to the intended use of the Gifford Pinchot National Forest and Mount St. Helens National Volcanic Monument.
Mining and exploratory drilling (the utilization of hydraulic fracking fluid, blasting, high-temperature refining)  pose an unacceptable risk to streams and drinking water, impacting public health, agriculture, and fisheries.
Ascot Resources, a foreign corporation, stands to reap all the profits, leaving people, animals, and ecosystems downstream with a legacy of pollution.
Mining and drilling in this iconic and fragile area would threaten the clean water, abundant wildlife and unspoiled beauty the region is known for, compromising local quality of life and our economy.




Other Ways You Can Help
Can't contribute? Want to know and do more?  Check out ways you can be involved!:

Check out our website for more information on the mine and our other ongoing restoration and conservation work!

Like us on Facebook and follow us on Twitter for updates and information! 
Take a look at our volunteer page for ways in which you can be involved with Mt. St. Helens! 
Contact your federal legislators: let them know hard rock drilling in national forests and near National Monuments is unacceptable 
If you're close by, take a hike out to Mt. St. Helens and take in the magnificence of the volcano and the beauty of the surrounding lands


And that’s all there is to it.

story:
Who We Are

We are four students from the University of Tennessee, Knoxville  raising funds to support Ijams Nature Center. As residents of the Knoxville community, we recognize the need for continual awareness of the nature surrounding us. Our mission is to raise money for Ijams, so they can combat the overgrowth of invasive species with the purchase of native plants. 

The four of us exploring the beauty of Ijams

 

Ijams is a 315-acre nature center located in Knoxville, dating back to the early twentieth century. This non-profit organization focuses on connecting our community with the natural world. Ijams offers a variety of ways for visitors to discover nature and all that it has to offer. They provide environmental education programs, hiking trails, paddle boarding, and rock climbing  for any individual searching for an outdoor adventure.

A nature trail at Ijams Nature Center

 

What We Need

We have set a fundraising goal of $1,500 for Ijams to expand their efforts in protecting their nature center against invasive, non-native plants and ivies such as Kudzu. The money our campaign aims to raise will enable Ijams to replant one acre of land with healthy, local vegetation.

Your tax-deductible donation will help Ijams thrive with native species, providing wildlife with safe food sources and habitats. The focus will be on purchasing seed producing plants and berry producing shrubs, which will act as continual nourishment for birds and deer in the area. The  purchase of these plants will not only help restore Ijams, but also to prevent further harm the invasive species have caused.

What You Get

We greatly appreciate any and all donations and have a variety of perks included for contributors. For a $10 donation, you can claim a social media shoutout on our Facebook page. When you donate $25, you can choose between two colors of a t-shirt. For a $100 donation, we will make a professional and personalized video for you or your company to share on its social media pages!

How It Helps

The purchase of native vegetation will not only directly effect Ijams and the wildlife who inhabit it, but the community as a whole. Ijams is a staple in Knoxville, and provides a refuge for individuals of all ages searching for an outdoor retreat. The flourishing of native plants will help to revitalize Ijams Nature Center, keeping it safe as Knoxville’s local treasure. 

The Ijams' Quarry on a Sunny day 

 

How Else You Can Help

If you are interested in contributing to our campaign but cannot currently donate, there are many other ways you can support Ijams!

Spread the word by sharing our campaign to your friends and family by liking and sharing our Facebook Page and Indiegogo page. Become an Ijams Nature Center member or sign up to volunteer today! Ijams can be reached via email, at chassil@ijams.org, or via phone, at (865) 577-4717. We greatly appreciate all donations towards the Vols For Ijams campaign.

“It’s a place where living with the earth and caring for the earth become one and the same.” -Ijams

story:
Make a Difference, One Tree at a Time

Trees are truly amazing. 

They give us food, medicine, support livelihoods, help prevent soil erosion, and oh, did you know that one tree can absorb (store) as much carbon in one year as a car produces over 26,000 miles?

So, we're doing two things at Planet releaf:

1. Expressing our gratitude by giving a gift that celebrates life. 

Birthdays, anniversaries, Valentine’s Days, Graduation Days and religious holidays mark important occasions in our year, which is why we’re planting awesome trees for the awesome people that rock our world.

Happy Birthday, dad!    

2. Giving back what we take out.

We like cars, electricity, mobile phones and fridge freezers! The point is not to stop our collective social or technological progress, but to live in harmony with the resourceful planet that makes all of these developments possible. 

About us.

We’re a small team with big ideas. Through our work with various UK charities, we've built a trusted network around the globe which means that you can plant your tree right here at home, or in a country where the environment is weaker like India, Pakistan, Kashmir, Tanzania, Gambia, Kenya, China, Nepal, Indonesia, Brazil or Palestine.

Why are we crowdsourcing on indiegogo?

We need a smart website that can explain our message in simple terms, and we have the backing of a few great individuals who are willing to finance this!

And because we're a social enterprise, they've also agreed to cover our operational costs for one whole year!

BUT

In return, they want us to plant 12,000 trees in 2014.  

Given that each tree can potentially absorb the carbon produced by a car travelling over 26,000 miles,

that's as much as 3.12 million miles of stored carbon
in our first 12 months!

AND if we do that, they'll plant another 12,000 trees the following year.   

AND the year after that!

So, that's our target.  

Crowdsourcing will put us on the map, and with your help we can start to make a difference from day one.  

Whatever we raise on indiegogo will be used to plant new trees for a greener, richer and healthier planet.


The Impact

Over the next few months, you're going to be part of something that will truly make a difference to our planet.  

We've got some experienced agencies on board that are donating their time and effort to this cause, and they'll be making sure that our presence is felt across social media, and all over the web.

We're aiming to plant a million trees every year, across the different continents!

Other Ways You Can Help

Share this link with your network, and put in a good word for our cause :)

story:
Help Us Share the Moke!


Let the mountains talk, let the river run. Once more, and forever.— David Brower

In 1989, Sierra Nevada foothill residents founded the Foothill Conservancy to stop the 450-foot Devil’s Nose Dam, which would have destroyed over nine miles of the wild North Fork Mokelumne River. Since that first victory, we have become the leading organization in California for upper Mokelumne River conservation. In 2009, we saved miles of the Mokelumne by stopping one of the state’s largest water utilities from expanding Pardee Reservoir. We use grassroots organizing, advocacy, and the occasional lawsuit to achieve our goals, always working with community and conservation partners.

Now, we need your help to protect the Mokelumne River for good. Wild and Scenic River designation for 37 miles of the Moke would create a protected river corridor more than 60 miles long. To achieve that goal, we are raising money to purchase a fully outfitted raft. That will allow us to share the river’s scenic beauty and wild nature with opinion leaders and public officials whose support we need to protect our river for generations to come.

There is nothing like taking people out on our beloved Moke to help them understand why we need to save this beautiful river. It’s easy for them to ignore the wonders of the river if it’s only a line on the map or something they see from its bridges. But once people raft the Mokelumne and experience its beauty and its magic, they understand why we need to save it.

By contributing to the Help Us Share the Moke campaign you will help add the Mokelumne to the list of approximately 25 rivers and streams in California that have a portion of their reach protected by national or state Wild and Scenic designation. This designation will protect the river forever – ensuring that 37 miles of free-flowing stream benefit people, fish and wildlife for generations to come. There is no better gift for your family, your children and our Sierra Foothill communities than to ensure the Mokelumne stays a flowing river for good. 


Learn more about the Foothill Conservancy and what we do by visiting: www.foothillconservancy.org


What We Need & Perks for You!

We need to generate about $10,000 to purchase the equipment we need to share the Mokelumne River safely and effectively. Since we are a nonprofit organization, we can get great deals on rafting products and we need your help to take advantage of them. Whitewater rafts and gear are not cheap. But they’re a whole lot of fun and they last for decades. 

Depending on the amount of money we raise, we have different options. Our priority is to purchase the raft, paddles, and safety gear first. If we receive enough contributions, we can also purchase oars and an oar frame.

If you wish to donate money to our campaign but don't wish to claim any of the perks, please click on the donation range category. The next screen will ask which perk you wish to receive. If you choose not to claim a perk, simply select: No perk necessary. Your contribution will go directly to our effort for a Wild and Scenic Mokelumne River.

The Perks!

We have awesome rewards to thank you for contributing to our Help Us Share the Moke campaign. They are attractive, practical, and make excellent gifts for that special nature lover in your life.

  1. Our Wild and Scenic stickers are about 2 x 3.5 inches tall, waterproof and built to last for years indoors or outside. They are a beautiful addition and show your support for a Wild and Scenic Mokelumne on your car, front door, window, water bottle, or wherever you think to stick one. 
  2. We printed sets of beautiful note cards that you can use for correspondence. Everyone loves a nice handwritten letter. Use them to catch up with friends, family, or anyone you need to contact in a special way.
  3. We had Klean Kanteen print our Wild and Scenic Mokelumne logo on their new stainless steel pint cups. Perfect for your favorite beverage. 
  4. Our Wild and Scenic Mokelumne River t-shirts are made in the USA from Organic Cotton. They come in blue or black and feature our Wild and Scenic logo on the back. These shirts look and feel great!
  5. Our greatest perks: The Foothill Conservancy is coordinating a range of unique outings in the coming year to help you experience all the beauty the Mokelumne River has to offer. Choose from: 

The Trips!

Spring Birding Extravaganza on the Mokelumne (dates TBA) with Gwen Starrett.

  • Did you know that the Electra run of the Mokelumne River is a hotspot for great spring birding and wildflowers? Join local birding expert Gwen Starrett to spend the morning looking for and listening to the beautiful birds of a Mokelumne River spring.

Summer Nature Journaling in the Watershed (dates TBA) with Gwen Starrett.

  • Want to learn how to use those watercolors or colored pencils you've been wanting to use? A peaceful summer afternoon by the river can be incredibly inspiring and productive with the coaching of expert birder and artist Gwen Starrett.

Mokelumne Watershed and Infrastructure Tour with Pete Bell and Katherine Evatt.

  • Ever wondered where your water comes from? How it travels from high in the mountains down to your tap after generating power and being diverted off the river in multiple locations? This is your chance to learn all the hidden nooks and crannies of the Mokelumne Canyon. Spend a day following the river and its "plumbing" system down the canyon with two of Amador County's most knowledgeable Mokelumne River experts: Pete Bell and Katherine Evatt.  

If you claim a perk with one of these trips, we'll contact you to find out your preference and schedule the best date.

Contact: If you have any questions about the perks or any part of the campaign, please give us a call at 209-295-4900, or send Reuben an email. We would love to talk with you.


Why this Project Will Make a Difference

Most people who live in the watershed will tell you they like the Mokelumne River exactly as it is now. By protecting 37 miles of the river through state or federal Wild and Scenic designation, we will prevent the Mokelumne from facing new threats from dams and guarantee that the river will remain the way it is now for generations to come. 

In the nearly 25 years we have been protecting the Mokelumne River, we have had many great victories and sought collaborative, community-based, and creative new approaches to helping the communities around us solve difficult problems. 

The most powerful tool we have to protect the Mokelumne River for future generations is state or federal Wild and Scenic River designation. Floating down a river gives folks a chance to view the river from a completely new perspective, connecting people with the processes and places that matter most. Your involvement and community contribution in the Help Us Share the Moke campaign will ensure that we can provide an on-river experience for people who have the power to shape the future of the Mokelumne.

Contributions to this campaign will go towards the purchase of the raft and gear we need to take policy makers down the river.


Other Ways You Can Help

We'll extend gracious thanks to you and any of your friends for any size contribution--from $1 up to $1 million (we can dream, can't we?). 

If you can't contribute money, you can still help Save the Moke. Here's how:

  • Endorse Wild and Scenic designation for the Moke using our online form. 
  • Make some noise about our campaign! Tell your friends via email or word of mouth. Post it to your blog, Facebook, Twitter, or local bulletin board! 
  • Remember to use the share link at the top of this page (below the video) to get more people involved!

Thank you so much! From the Foothill Conservancy team!

Together, we can share and save the Moke!

There's nothing . . . absolutely nothing . . . half so much worth doing as simply messing around in boats. — (Kenneth Grahame, The Wind in the Willows)
